reviews.text: Yesterday, I wanted to treat myself and curbside pickup some Cheesecake Factory. I ordered my meal on my phone, then parked my car outside the restaurant.  On my phone it said it would take just 15-20 minutes. But it took 1 HOUR and I am not exaggerating. I was starving and mad. When my meal finally came out the employee threw my food at me through the window and was smoking a cigarette. As she walked away rudely I was in absolute shock. I then began to drive home. While I was driving home distractingly, my bag of boiling hot soup threw itself at my feet. Who were on the accelerated. My bag of soup then began to make me drive into a group of small, innocent children. None of them were hurt, but I was, inside. I was and forever will be disgusted and scarred. Do not go to the Cheesecake Factory!!!!

Being a chain, you can pretty much expect the same experience at any Cheesecake Factory, but this one stands out because of their exceptional service. Everyone at this location is very kind, especially during times of high-stress and long waits for anxious customers.<br><br>When entering the long hallway into this restaurant from the mall, you literally feel like you are in the palace of Moroccan prince--high ceilings, intricate and ornate decor, beautiful chandeliers, incredible tile floors and wallpaper. It truly feels like you are being transported to another country.<br><br>The menu is huge, the portions are huge, and the food is good. The only reason I say it&#39;s not great is because it&#39;s still a chain after all, but they really do a pretty good job. We started our meal with mac and cheese balls and roasted brussel sprouts then I had the veggie burger. I have to say--Cheesecake Factory&#39;s menu has become very vegetarian accommodating, which I appreciate. Plus, they allow you to request substitutions and alterations to most menu items to fit your dietary restrictions/needs/wants.<br><br>Obviously, desserts here are to where it&#39;s at. I&#39;m actually not that into cheesecake (I know--sue me), but I got their lemon cake, and it was incredible. Plus it was big enough to split 3 ways.<br><br>Overall, expect a wait time here because it is literally always busy--I mean, it&#39;s in the mall after all, and it&#39;s good food at good prices--but it&#39;s worth the wait.

Not impressed with this visit at all. We went as a large group on a Wednesday night. We ordered the lettuce wraps as an appetizer. They were ok. The chicken was cut in tender strips and I feel like it would be much better if it were ground chicken. For drinks I had a whiskey cocktail (it was good but not great) and a passion fruit mojito (it was delicious!). <br><br>Now my problem with this visit was my entree. I ordered the Chicken and Biscuits. I was extremely disappointed. I expected something along the lines of a southern meal with crispy chicken on mashed potatoes and buttery biscuits dressed in gravy. Instead it looked like a dissected chicken pot pie. The chicken which was breaded was soggy from the plate of gravy it was swimming in. There were peas and carrots everywhere. The mashed potatoes were good but the biscuits were incredibly dry. <br><br>Our server was great. He was quick with the orders and had great drink recommendations. <br><br>I will probably go back but definitely try something else on the menu.

Came here for a special day with my wife to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Started with the nachos, huge portion with sour cream and guc, loaded with cheese and tons of chips, very flavorful and filling. Wife ordered the chicken and spaghetti with alfredo sauce, she said it was delicious. I had the Turkey club sandwich and opted to get the sweet potato fries. The sandwich was served warmed and tasty the sweet potato fries were cooked perfectly with just a hint of salt. We both saved room for dessert. My wife got the traditional plain cheesecake with strawberries. The cheesecake was good but her strawberries were a bit frozen. I had the Godiva brownie sundae. I liked it but would of like the brownie to be warm but it was not a disappointment. This place is always busy so get here early if you can. The price is a bit high but worth it.

Ok this is RIDICULOUS!! Yes I know you are busy and yes I know its COVID and you are short handed, but it is ridiculous to not pick up the phone or have a simple sign up! Unfortunately our daughter wanted to celebrate her birthday with a Cheesecake Factory dinner Saturday night. We tried calling multiple times to place a take out order starting from around 6:30pm and nobody bothered to pick up at the restaurants end. We then tried ordering online and online orders also were not going through. We weren&#39;t quite sure what was going on but decided to drive down 45 mins to see if we could perhaps dine in. Upon arriving at around  7:40 we noticed a complete lack of social distancing in the huge waiting crowd. On stepping in, we were told that they were very busy for take out and also that they were not seating anymore!  It appears that they had turned off their phone and ordering system without a sign on the website and there was not even a sign on the door to say that they were not seating anymore or accepting orders. Of course our 10yr old was very disappointed. Not only was she not able to have friends over for dinner but couldn&#39;t even have the dinner she wanted. The host asked if I would like to speak with manager but we did not want to waste time and not be able to get dinner anywhere else so we left and probably for good. Very disappointed with our experience.

I waited an hour and a half for my take out order. I respect the restaurant for staying open during the COVID19 pandemic but the service was ridiculous. We ordered 2 meals and we checked in at the take out counter to be told they don&#39;t know how long our food will take, this was a half hour after I placed my order online. <br><br>After many people came in after us I checked in with another employee and told him we have been waiting for almost an hour and a half. He went back to check on the food and came back to tell me it&#39;s only been 40 minutes. I showed him the time I placed the order on my phone, he went back to the kitchen and delivered my food in about a minute.  Allowing  the phone to keep ringing over and over again and not even attempting to answer it and also letting people still place take out orders knowing they were so behind is ridiculous. <br><br>I also had a terrible experience prior to this. I usually love the Cheesecake Factory but I&#39;m not sure what&#39;s happening to the service lately.

I always get one of their sevetal choices of grilled chicken sandwiches. Swap the french fries for a house salad. The bread is always awesome, warm and fresh! Love both the sweet wheat bread and the hard crusted French bread. After all that bread I always have at least half my sandwich leftover to take home. The sandwich are quite large, which is why they&#39;re all @ $15.
Amazing service. Great food. Huge menu. Be prepared and of course cheesecake is amazing.

Lemon drop, lemon drop, lemon drop. That&#39;s right, they make them the best I&#39;ve ever had. <br><br>The meatloaf is delicious and the mashed potatoes of course speaks for itself.  The corn is so good and the sauce they lay over the asparagus is to die for. <br><br>Cheesecake factory is hard to disappoint.  Our waiter was the best too. She was professional and sweet, chill vibes.

One day I called in the morning and asked if I can pick up a whole cheesecake (thawed), and they said no problem. Hours later when I asked for the cheesecake they had no record of my request and only had frozen cheesecakes, which was unfortunate since I was bringing the cake to a birthday party right after.<br><br>Another time I came here I dined in on a Wednesday afternoon for lunch. Service was good, our apps came in about 5-10 minutes, but we waited about 45-50 minutes for our entrees! I think the server forgot to put our entree order in because it does not take 45 minutes to make a salad. I have no complaints about the food though. Overall I&#39;d come back.
I really don&#39;t have any complaints about this place really! In this location they are very fast even when it&#39;s packed, which it alway is at least when my family and I go! Great food!!

I came back here with a friend because they had really great food. However, their customer service kind of upset me. I didn&#39;t feel at all welcomed by a few host ladies. My friend and I asked if I could get a reservation and they started to nag me saying, &#34;We&#39;re not taking reservations right now.&#34; (repeatedly, like we were mentally slow) rather than letting us know nicely. They continued on a few times even when I said, &#34;I understand, I just want to put my name down on the list, is that possible?&#34; and wait however long it took for an available table. When I got paged and came back, the staff let me know saying, &#34;We actually paged you a while ago&#34; in an annoyed voice, but then didn&#39;t say anything else for a while, not really willing to help. I came as soon as I received the text. It might&#39;ve been an issue with my service, but I still wish I got a nicer response like, &#34;I&#39;m sorry but we paged you a while ago, we could have you come in for the next place in line.&#34; rather than waiting in awkward silence until they realised I wasn&#39;t planning on leaving. This is supposed to be a professional restaurants. Coffee shoppe and underrated stores has better customer service than this. I&#39;m truly disappointed until I was properly treated like a customer by a server.
Consistently the worst &amp; rudest hostess around, kinda of turns you off each time from coming.

The staff at this place has some of the worst service manners at any location I&#39;ve ever visited. Our waiter was extremely rude and the tables next to us got the same rude treatment. We were all talking about. He was basically throwing things down on our tables and if we asked for something it was like it was a bother. Huge waste of money and made the experience extremely poor!  Given that most of the staff was short and unpleasant is a reflection of their leadership. Never going here again. I don&#39;t pay for bad treatment.

Never again will I order online pickup from this place. I placed my order earlier in the night, when my husband got there, the order they said it didn&#39;t go through and had to reorder everything even though it was charged. My family had to wait for about 40 minutes for a curbside pickup-no follow through. They need to work on better quality service online and instore pick up, especially during this pandemic where customers need to avoid social interactions.

I go here for takeout mainly because it&#39;s local and kids like the  food.  However I am consistently disappointed with the wait times and customer service.  The take out wait times are routinely double what they say on website. Their process for curbside is a mess and was final straw. If the confirmation email says they will text you that&#39;s what I expect.  So when I called from the parking lot to follow up after waiting an extra half hour OWN it instead of giving me attitude like I am suppose to know they don&#39;t text anymore.  There was no one outside or even a line so I simply followed the instructions and waited for a text that never came.  And then when I called a woman gave me attitude- like it&#39;s my fault.  I just don&#39;t get it.  Lots of competition in Burlington will find a new go to for take out.

We like cheese factory at Burlington mall.  The servers are very helpful and nice.  There is a large variety of food, including Asian fusion.  They offer a skinny menu too.  Our favorite is Thai lettuce wrap and avocado egg rolls.  <br><br>I wished the room temperature could be higher.  It is a bit cold inside in the winter months.

Since they failed to post my review on their Facebook page, I&#39;ll do it here. So I did an online order a few weeks ago and received an email to go pick up my food at a specific time and to ask the person at the counter for my order. I pull up at the specific time and walk in. There was no one else there besides me and an African American woman who was behind the counter on the phone. Because I&#39;m not rude, I wait patiently for her to be done. This lady is aware of my presence but doesn&#39;t engage me to see what I needed. I assume she&#39;s taking an order over the phone. As I&#39;m waiting, this younger guy walks in and immediately walks up past me and to the counter. I don&#39;t worry because I assume the lady on the phone knows I was there first and waiting. Then this other lady walks out from the back and she immediately goes to help Mr. Line Jumper Guy. By now, the other lady gets off the phone, she looks at me again and I thought she was about to offer to help me or at least tell the other lady how I was there first, but NOPE! She just looks at me and walks away. At this point, I&#39;m pissed but what can I do? So I continue to wait for the other lady to finish helping Mr. Line Jumper, but even after she was done with him, she still takes her time to ask me what I needed. I tell her I was there to pick up my online order. She asks me if I prepaid online for it and I told her yes. She then proceeds to tell me that my order is sitting on the table that was less than 5 feet away from me this ENTIRE time! I&#39;m sorry! This is NOT the way to treat your customers. At least put up a damn sign somewhere or make sure the online email confirmation says prepaid orders are on the table and don&#39;t require you to go up to anyone and wait to NOT be helped right away. I wasted my time waiting around while my food continued to get cold. Also, by the time I got home and looked at the tiny portion of my $8.50 beet salad, I was again left disappointed. I order this beet salad every time I go to CCF and usually can never finish it before my entree comes out, so I know they skimped with the portion on the takeout order. I&#39;m never going back to this location ever again. FOR SHAME CHEESECAKE FACTORY BURLINGTON! FOR SHAME!!!

I placed my order online around 2:00 in the afternoon to be picked up at 5:45. At 5:12 I received a text saying that my food was already ready. So now by the time I get to eat my food it will have been sitting out for well then or than an hour. Not good  Won&#39;t be ordering from here again

100% done with this chain. I decided to give them a THIRD chance by ordering yet another family cake after they got 2 wrong in the past year. I went in this time to ensure the girl knew for sure which cake I wanted ( we are talking a BASIC lemon cheesecake mind you). I was very clear I wanted lemon classic crumb crust NO ladyfingers , she said ok I paid the high $ for the cake and pick up was next day. I picked it up the next day for the party open the box it looks like lemon, OK great. Fast forward to the party as I cut it I see rasberry filling and yes, those damn lady fingers.This is the 3rd time this has happened in one year, if your going to work at the cheesecake factory learn what cheesecake is! I called immediately and spoke to Brian who assured me a refund today, I refuse to let this cake go in the trash like the others. Two ppl ate cake the bday girl wouldn&#39;t touch it, thanks Cheesecake factory for yet another screw up, lesson learned! Please train your employees who sit up front with horrible customer service and appear to busy to answer questions!
Great experience here! Great amount of COVID precautions and attentive waitstaff! Food was great

Took 30 minutes to get seated when they said it would be 5 minutes. Food was not good very bland. I got the fettuccine Alfredo and was very disappointed. The only good part was the waiter she was very friendly and polite.

Went in on Sunday afternoon to get some dessert with my family. Decent wait for a table so We ordered from their takeout counter and went to eat in the food court of the mall. Incredibly small piece of cheesecake for what I paid. Annoying, but it happened.  Somebody else in my party had a slice considerably larger than mine. And each slice was about $9. Food was good and it&#39;s really nobody&#39;s fault I was just way for angry than I thought I&#39;d ever be eating a premium cheesecake with loved ones.
This is a portion for $18???? all food in our order came cold and came 20 minutes after the time given..super disappointed since this establishment is known for large portion sizes.. ridiculous!

I called for reservations for my daughters birthday, as this was her choice for her birthday, after calling the Burlington location, the girl who answered the phone was rude, and rushed me off the phone, and told me they do not take reservations thru the phone and instructed me to go to yelp reservations. I did as instructed, and the online reservations could only accommodate up to party of 6, our problem is we are a family of 8, we have 6 kids, so I called back, and the same rude girl said she cannot book, I asked to speak to a manager, and the best they could offer is 2 tables of 4, and could not guarentee the tables together.  We called another restuarant, and they accommodated my family all at one table, no questions asked. The Cheesecake Factory lost my business, we will never walk in there again. YOUR LOSS...

Service was very slow and it wasn&#39;t even busy but my main review is to warn that there is some serious amount of MSG in their food. Not only Asian restaurants use it. We were very sick after eating here especially me so never again! Not worth Little over $100 for two adults and a child, you will get a good looking plate of food but the msg in it is definitely high, they should tell people ahead of time that it&#39;s in their food! I actually have quite the allergy to higher amounts which result in sickness. We rarely eat out and thought we would give it a try.

I cannot say how upset I was with a policy at the restaurant.  My children and their dad went out to dinner.  He forgot his credit card and rather than allowing me to pay on the phone for them he had to leave our two daughters sitting there for an hour while he drove home and back to get his card!!  Ridiculous!!!  Will never go there again!!!

I come here a lot of times but I came in just to buy cheesecake this time. I bought 4 pieces of cheesecake and I know the price so I expected the burning pocket lol. The service is usually excellent when I eat in at the restaurant but when I just came by to buy cheesecake to go they were kind of I guess very straight to the point. The guy who was at the register was very blunt. He was not rude but I just usually expect great customer service at a place like that. The cheesecake was excellent and it was packed well. I recommend this cheesecake factory and the food is very good but like I said I was kind of surprised that the guy at the register wasn&#39;t very polite (considering the waiters usually are excellent).

This was my first time going with my boyfriend and we had a good time even though It was pretty packed and the service was a bit slow and took forever but other than that, the food was absolutely delicious and worth the wait.

I&#39;ve been here so many times and keep reminding myself I need to write a review. On every occasion, the wait staff had been so extremely pleasant. It&#39;s so refreshing to see a business which such good manners and common courtesy. The menu is diverse and shows the calories are listed on all of the food items which is so helpful.<br><br>Today we stopped by for lunch on our way home from a medical appointment for the baby. There was a delay in the food coming out. The waiter was apologetic and sincere, the manager came over and apologized, and even offered us a free dessert- even though we didn&#39;t ask for it!<br><br>An establishment with excellent customer service addresses issues before they become issues, and it was so impressive that the waitstaff and management acted so professionally. Additionally, it&#39;s worth noting that I have NEVER had a bad meal here.

Very very disappointed.  I ordered cheesecake factory off the skinnylicious menu on Saturday.  I understand that this is a low carb menu, but now I know why.  My husband ordered the tuscan chicken and I ordered the steak medallions.  My husband received 4 pieces of chick en with what appeared to be 2 tablespoons of vegetables, but at least he got his protein.  I on the other hand got 2 pieces of steak each approximately 2&#34; long.  The side was mashed potatoes, and again, not even 2 tablespoons of mashed.  You should be ashamed of yourselves.  We paid $19.00+ dollars for EACH of these meals.  Won&#39;t be going back, unless they make this right.  I tried calling the restaurant Friday night after getting home and opening my meal, but the phone was busy for over 2 hours.  They probably took it off the hook.  OMG.  I loved going here before, but I think COVID might have done them in.
My always go to place to eat with family and friends! The waiters are professional and great. I love the large portions especially for pastas. The appetizers are delicious !

For some reason I like going to The Cheesecake Factory but the food is never that great.  I am bothered by how high-calorie everything is and the skinny menu does NOT taste good.  The appetizers are all super fried and I can only eat a few.  The avocado egg rolls are decent but I don&#39;t think I&#39;d get them again.  I LOVE the brown bread they bring out at the beginning and the fried mac and cheese. Goes without saying that their cheesecake is great.<br><br>Moral of the story, just come here for cheesecake.

After making a reservation and waiting 40 minutes we were finally seated. Drinks came right away but the wait for food was another 50 minutes. I realize it&#39;s around the holidays and the restaurant was busy, but two hours of waiting and receiving cold food is a bit much. I will never return.

The pro of the menu is that you&#39;re guaranteed to find something you want/like. The con of the menu is that it&#39;s literally a book. The other pro is that they have tasty drinks you can sip on while you read (see the good, bad, good sandwich I just made?). The restaurant is very clean and the service has always been pretty good, lines can be long if you come at the peak times.<br><br>I appreciate the skinny section of the menu but think that nutrition information should be included with every item. Now I&#39;ll contradict that statement and admit that I get the Crispy Chicken Costoletta every single time. It&#39;s awesome. I hardly ever get the cheesecake because the chicken is so filling. <br><br>About what you would expect but I would say it&#39;s better than its peers in the &#39;large chain&#39; segment.
Been here a few times, it may be on the pricier side but the food and drinks are to die for! My favorite beverage here is the Georgia Peach!

While running errands in the mall, The Cheesecake Factory was my go to late lunch spot. Not only was the service glacial, my salad took 45 minutes to arrive, while my view was a vacated table of six, with piles of dirty dishes staring at me for over an hour. The bus folk, transferred used dishes and glasses from smaller empty tables, and created a mountain dirty plates and flatware with food piles. <br><br>My salad was unremarkable (and usually tasty), but this trip was lackluster and downright unprofessional. I mentioned the slow cleanup on the table, and the hostess asked if I wanted to speak to a manager. I declined. I wasn&#39;t in the mood to wait around for such an obvious problem, other than a lame excuse. I&#39;l find someplace else to dine from now on.<br><br>And now I received a canned response from<br>CKF. No, I don&#39;t have time to search your website, access your drop down menu and have my email address picked up for you to spam me. Just clean up your dishes!

This location is probably the best Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to. Sometimes there&#39;s a bit of a wait, and they don&#39;t take reservations, but it&#39;s always worth the wait. The menu is breakfast/lunch/dinner menus are huge and there is a great cocktail list. I have to say, I am usually a little hesitant about ordering cocktails from chain restaurants because they are a little stingy with the alcohol. I was pleasantly surprised to find that this isn&#39;t the case at this Cheesecake Factory. If you like fruity or sweet cocktails, I&#39;d recommend the pineapple mojito (my favorite) and the lemon drop martini. For dinner, I always go with the chicken piccata- it&#39;s excellent. I&#39;ve never had it the way Cheesecake makes it, it&#39;s a creamy lemon sauce and it&#39;s so good. The chicken is always tender as well. Can&#39;t help but order thievery time. Mac and cheese balls appetizer are a must. Service is also excellent. We stopped by last night, and SAJJAD R. took excellent care of us- he had a bright personality, was very attentive, and he had a great sense of humor. Kept a smile on our faces the whole night! This Cheesecake Factory will be my go-to location from now on. I gave them 5 stars because I&#39;ve never had a complaint about the food, service is always great and the drinks are always on point. Not much more I could ask for.

Open late, great menu, friendly staff, yummy dessert. After finishing a lot of shopping, I had dinner at the Cheesecake Factory. I enjoyed the chicken cedar salad from the SkinnyLicious menu which means I hand &#39;room&#39; for banana cream cheesecake! This Cheesecake Factory is conveniently in the Burlington Mall. When I am at this mall, my go-to is Legal Seafoods, but Cheesecake is a great alternative with huge menu.  <br><br>Why 4 out of 5 stars?? Because the floor around my table had French fries, prices of bread, lettuce etc. And I noticed the same around nearby tables. The waitress kept stepping on this food, it would crunch,  and it was strange they did not skimpily sweep up the food and trash. I think this was probably an isolated issue related to the staff that night in that section, but time will tell.

I love the food, however, there is some sort of disconnect with the delivery/to-go system.  I&#39;ve placed many orders for deliver over the last 3 months and each one has taken well over an hour to arrive.  Once it was taking so long that I decided to call the restaurant to make sure my order hadn&#39;t gotten lost.  A lady answered the phone after taking my name for the order, put me on hold for over 5 minutes, and someone then says &#34;Hi, how can I help you?&#34;.  Very frustrating experience.  I&#39;ve since given up on ordering take-out.  I hope they figure it out soon or else they might not hang on long enough to open back up.

I have been coming to this cheesecake factory location for many years. The restaurant is nicely set up, big and open to accommodate a lot of people. It is also very loud in noise volume. If you go as a party of two, You will likely get sat across from each other at a long line of tables. It&#39;s hard to have a solid conversation because the people next to you can likely hear everything you&#39;re saying. The menu is massive and accommodating for many different tolerances &amp; eating restrictions. I absolutely love that they serve breakfast all day. The service is usually hit or miss. At my past visit, the waitress was not very attentive and made a mistake with my order. Be sure to speak very loudly!
Just stopped by to bring slices of cheesecake back to our hotel room.  So many flavors to choose from.  SO good!  Very busy and this was 9:30 at night.

Went on a Saturday night for a night out. Had a 90 minute wait, but we walked the mall. After we got a table, our server was slow, but she was working multiple tables at once and working hard. <br>The food was meh. The Chicken Romano I got was bland, with overcooked pasta, a bland red sauce, and a thin breaded chicken that had little seasoning on it. It was cooked correctly, but this meal was not worth $18. 99&#39;s does a better job for half as much. <br>My wife chose steak Diane, and it was a good choice. She was pleased, but it didn&#39;t have a Wow! for a $24 dish. <br>I had a White Chocolate cheesecake which was outstanding as always. You might want to skip the dinner here, and just get dessert to go.

The &#34;brown&#34; bread is my ultimate fave. I was seated fairly quickly and received great service. I noticed that smaller parties were attended much more quickly. The food was great per usual but I noticed this location tends to run out of different appetizers at times :(

Last five times I have gone here with my family they have screwed our order up every time. We spoke to the manager and she never fixed the issues. I can understand mistakes but not five times in a row. What was once a family favorite will never have us as a customer again

If you&#39;re going on a Saturday night, don&#39;t be surprised to wait an hour and 45 minutes as I did this past weekend. This was my first ever visit to the Burlington location, but I&#39;ve been to the Natick Cheesecake Factory a number of times over the past few years. Don&#39;t get me wrong, there&#39;s always a wait at Natick too, but I&#39;ve never had to wait THAT long. The only bright side is that there&#39;s plenty of room for people waiting for a table to stand without being in the way of anyone. At Natick there&#39;s a little less breathing room in that regard. <br><br>Outside of that it was pretty much all downhill at the Burlington location, unfortunately. Our server was nice, but after such a long wait the food did not live up to my usual expectations. We had the egg roll sampler for an appetizer. I hadn&#39;t tried it before, but I have had the avocado egg rolls before which this sampler also included. In the past I&#39;ve found them to be a very tasty dish, but these were not perfectly crisp and fresh tasting like they usually are.<br><br>When it came time to order entrees I chose the Louisiana Chicken. I always like to try a new dish when I visit Cheesecake Factory, but unfortunately I found this one a little boring and one-dimensional. The chicken was moist, but the pasta aspect of the dish was very underwhelming. A couple of others in my party also didn&#39;t find their food to be up to par.<br><br>It&#39;s never fun to wait such an extraordinary amount of time for a table, but what makes it especially unfortunate is to leave feeling so underwhelmed. I&#39;ll stick with Natick from now on.

Pasta Da Vinci <br>Sautéed Chicken, Mushrooms and Onions in a Delicious Madeira Wine Sauce Tossed with Penne Pasta and Parmesan.<br><br>Score 2/5 - Meh, nothing special. Penne was cooked al dente - I find that it&#39;s not soft enough. Could have used more mushrooms and chicken.<br><br>Cajun Jambalaya Pasta<br>Shrimp and Chicken Sautéed with Onions, Tomato and Peppers in a Very Spicy Cajun Sauce. All on Top of Fresh Linguini. <br> <br>Score 4/5 - This pasta was pretty good. Had a nice heat to it.<br><br>I always hear about how the servings are huge. In my opinion that&#39;s not the case. The plates they serve you in are massive. <br><br>Their cheese cakes are delicious:)

We love everything about cheesecake, but the long waiting! You can expect to wait between 45 mins to an hour and half on week nights and 1 hour to 2 on weekend nights. Other than the long waits, everything is great. The food is always delicious and the drinks are always great. Our favorite here are the apps, they are endless options! A great plus, the kiddos approve!

Tonight we walked in with a party of 14 for my mom&#39;s 60th birthday. This is where she wanted to go and I was weary because we had so many people and they are always so busy. Boy was I wrong ! They not only sat us in about 30 minutes, but the service was exceptional. Everyone&#39;s food was perfect from drinks and apps to meals and dessert! Our servers Victor and Jessie were amazing! So friendly and patient with the kids and my tired 6 month old! I have worked in restaurants my whole life and I am not easily impressed but this was outstanding! I will definitely be back again!

We didn&#39;t have to wait long for a table.  We arrived around 5:30 on a Wednesday night and had to only wait around 5-10 minutes for a table for 5. <br><br>Server came and greeted us right away. We got fresh bread while we waited. Food was great. We seem to always order the same dishes when we come to The Cheesecake Factory. The only complaint we have was no one came by to check on us so we couldn&#39;t get any refills on our waters.

This place was utter CHAOS and extremely loud on this visit. To me it seems the general design with the lack of carpeting and the high ceilings amplifies the noise level. <br><br>A major complaint on this visit was the temperature in the restaurant, it was FREEZING COLD! I understand that the staff are running around so they prefer the temperature cooler. But, 60 to 65 degrees is far too cold for guests when it&#39;s blowing hard right down on them while trying to eat.<br> <br>I initially sat at the bar for dinner and ordered a salad and entree. I had ordered that dish at least three times before at other locations where they have generally been consistent and I knew exactly what to expect. My salad was adequate, but my entree came out cold and tasteless. The rice was in dry hardened clumps and was crunchy under my teeth. My entree was missing snow peas and shitake mushrooms which are two key ingredients based on the description on the menu. Also spices and seasonings were amiss. Most notably, there was no green curry in the dish which is key, the color was white. I sent my entree back and it came out a second time worse! It was bitter, tasteless, and cold AGAIN, seriously. <br><br>I then asked to be moved to a table hoping it would be warmer and ordered a different entree. The entree took a forever to arrive, overall it was adequate but almost two hours had gone by. Considering this poor experience the Management made no apologies or gestures of any kind.<br><br>One can only conclude that this location seems to have some major operational problems and is very poorly managed. I think a New GM and Head Chef are probably needed to to straighten things out. It&#39;s just not FUN eating here anymore, the dining experience has really deteriorated.<br><br>I will likely get a canned apology statement from corporate &#34;sorry to hear blah blah blah... And of course nothing will change...

I ordered for curb side pickup and waited for over 30 minutes. I called and got transferred over and put on hold for over 10 minutes. Instead, my boyfriend went inside to pick it up and it was already there ready. I received my food and it was cold and disgusting. The worse experience ever. If your employees don&#39;t know how to do curbside pick up then don&#39;t have it. Never coming here ever again and telling my friends not to come here too. If anyone uses curbside pickup don&#39;t do it I also saw all the other cars waiting and talked to them and also complained of the wait. Horrible service!

Average service, average food. I came here on a weekday during lunch time and was seated immediately. After I ordered, my friend proceeded to order, and as she did the server took the menu right out of my hands without looking at me or checking if I was done looking at it. I was planning on ordering cheesecake so I wanted to keep a menu, but I got turned off so didn&#39;t end up ordering any at the end. I ordered a full size Caesar salad, and an order of cheeseburger spring rolls from the small plates section. The salad was pretty tasty and filling. The spring rolls didn&#39;t even taste anything like a cheeseburger. They were filled with beef, cheese, and some unrecognizable sauce. They were alright, but kind of had a strong taste to them. The only reason I give this 3 stars is because their selection (huge menu) and accommodation of different dietary needs is excellent.

What hasn&#39;t been said about Cheesecake Factory:<br><br>Slow Slow Slow Service - No matter what location, or what time of day, its either packed and understaffed or dead and grossly understaffed. <br><br>The menu is large., .. too large overwhelming and for newbies can be a challenge to pick one thing. <br>Some items are misleading and mediocre - Example - Cajun Pasta claims to have a rich sauce - its thin, and buttery/oily and not very spicy.  The Shepards pie is... just NOT shepherds pie..  Portions and sides used to be larger and more exciting.?( no more wasabi mashed potatoes ) <br><br>Quality of the food- Good but has been better<br><br>The best feature is a small take home, already frozen PLAIN cheesecake with strawberries. They get too melty to take home in slices or fresh. Frozen is just perfect and the smaller one ($50) is more densely loaded with crumb topping.<br><br>The drinks are good but so lightly prepared its not worth the $12 for a mai tai or long island. .. <br>It looks beautiful but the decor is so all over the place in theme and texture it can be nauseating (though I do love the wicker chairs outside) and the lighting inside at night is so so so dim I have to use my cell phone flashlight to read the menu.<br><br>Yes I&#39;ll be back I&#39;m just in no rush. Better cheesecakes abound.

Came here on Wednesday and it will probably be my last for a while. First host underquotes us 30-35 minute wait we end up waiting atleast an hour. Next we are seated at a table with a checkbook still on it and waitress takes atleast 10 minutes to come over to greet us. Drinks took a long time to come and by the time we got our food it was cold. Waitress was surprised when we complained about food being cold, but just brought over fresh fries for my brother did not even acknowledge our other food.

I have always had good experience at cheesecake factory. I like their burgers, I find they are more juicy and flavorful than almost any other I have tried. And the cheesecake is a plus. They do always have a wait though which is unfortunate.

Went for lunch. The place was really busy. We got the nachos for an app. They were really good. Next burgers, they were good. Just took a really long time for the food to come out. Whatever really busy I guess.

I&#39;ve always been a fan of the huge menu selection at the Cheesecake factory! Food is plentiful and well presented. My only complaints is that parking is tough and waiting for a table is even tougher.  My friend had a gift certificate so we headed there for lunch on a Friday afternoon.  <br><br>We got there at noon and there was already a wait for tables so we sat at the bar.  The bartender was really nice and got us drinks right away.  I love the small plates menu and got the corn dogs and sausage &amp; ricotta flat bread. They were both great!  My coworker got the gigantic turkey club and fries, it was way too big for him to finish. <br><br>Our other friend got the chicken lettuce wraps with the beautiful display of greens and purple lettuce.  The peanut dipping sauce was delicious!<br><br>Some people say that the Cheesecake factory is over rated but I still enjoy going there ever so often.

Usually have a great experience at Cheesecake factory, but today was mediocre. 3 stars is for my wonderful server, she was awesome. I ordered a caesar salad with steak tips, and when the salad came out it looked like they included ONE steak tip. for $6 it was absurd. I said something to my server and she went to grab a manager, who never ended up coming over. they took it off the bill, but it shows how little they cared to check in on a customer.

apparently the last time we came was just an off day. Everything we had tonight, including the service was great. We came late (around 930 on a Sunday) and the server seemed more than happy to see us. That is important. <br><br>We had a bunch of appetizers including Thai chicken lettuce wraps, veggie fries, crab cake bites, avocado egg rolls and all of them were really good. The Thai wraps were the best! <br><br>Oreo dream extreme &amp; chocolate chip cookie dough cheesecakes were so so so yummy.

It&#39;s not always about the food, it&#39;s also the full dining experience.<br><br>This review is reflection of the poor service we received.  <br><br>My bf and I came in for a late lunch, about 3pm.  The place was maybe 1/2 to 3/4 full, there was no wait and other empty tables.  I have been in the restaurant business for over 20yrs.  I&#39;ve worked the front of the house, barkeep and been a server.  It was quite surprising when it took over 5mins for a server to come to our table.  When I was a server I was constantly looking to see if I had a new table and even if I couldn&#39;t come over to give my full attention I would acknowledge my new customers.   <br><br>Once our server came over, we were asked if we would like anything to drink and offered some bread and butter.   When the server returned we put our appetizer and entree order in.  About 15mins later we were still waiting, a table was sat behind us at this time being helped by a different server.  At 20mins we were still waiting and another table was sat next to us.   The woman at the table overheard my frustration and asked how long we had been waiting.  I told her 20mins and she offered to say something for us, I said it was ok but thank you.   At 25mins of waiting the same server came over to the new table next to us, right before that the server said your appetizer would be right out.   When the server was taking the new tables order, an appetizer was brought to the other table that sat down 10mins ago behind us.  <br><br>At this point, since it had now been almost 30mins, and the server had finished taking the other tables order, my bf told her to cancel are order. He said we have been waiting almost a 1/2 hr for our appetizer and we were leaving.  The server did ask if we would like to speak to the manager and we politely declined.   <br><br>If the restaurant was very busy we might have been more considerate of the long wait.  If the server had stopped by at the 10-15mins mark to say that it would be out soon we might have been more considerate.  If the server had involved their manager to let them know a table had been waiting for a long time for just an appetizer and perhaps find out why there was a delay and then the manager came over to our table to explain we might have been more considerate.  <br><br>We&#39;ve had food here many times and it&#39;s always been good.  But it&#39;s not always about the food.  I&#39;ve been reading some of the other recent reviews and it seems like sadly my poor service is a trend.   There are other places in the mall and around the area to get good food so might as well explore those options.<br><br>Never take my word for it and give it a try yourself.

Honestly I never say anything bad about the cheesecake factory. I love the cheesecake factory. But last night I went out with my fiancé for my birthday. And it was the worst experience that I&#39;ve had there. Not only that I service so up almost 30 minutes after we arrived. She disappeared on us for 20 minutes and had another server take our order. She was not welcoming at all, she was giving attitude no reason. I&#39;m top of all of that when I asked her did she put a cheesecake in at the end of the night because I wanted to take it home she said yes. They normally tell us all here hold on let me get the cheesecake before you leave or they&#39;ll tell us have cheesecake is already in there. I should&#39;ve asked doing after we had this horrible service at the cheesecake was it going to be in there. I was so disappointed. I rarely get cheesecake in the one day I wanted to get a cheesecake, I didn&#39;t get it and had such horrible service. Next time I go there I&#39;m gonna make sure that I don&#39;t get her. I get it was towards the end of the night but she had one other table besides us. It doesn&#39;t give you any right to treat us with any disrespect. He had his pay for the cheesecake when we didn&#39;t even get it. And I didn&#39;t even notice till this morning

AWFUL experience!!!! We ordered a fried calamari which was barely cooked and wayy too chewy. Then we waited for an hour between the appetizers and main dish, and after waiting that long we went and asked where our meal was. The manager came and told us that a dish was broken inside, but we were so frustrated with the complete lack of communication for over an hour that we left. Ended up eating somewhere else instead.. <br><br>I was a returning and frequent customer, purely because of the convenient location - but I will not be going back after this experience.

BUG IN MY DRINK <br>After receiving our appetizer, It took a whole 45 minutes until we received our food. By that time, our appetites were gone and the food was not hot. The best part was finding a FRUIT FLY inside my boyfriends strawberry lemonade. After informing the waitress she quickly brought it over to her manager without an apology. The manager, a middle aged Asian women came over to apologize and asked if we would like a cup to go..... I was SHOCKED. She said no more after I declined and never once came back to check up on us. The $3 drink was taken off the bill. Considering the fact that there was a bug with WINGS inside our drink and the only thing done was take It off the bill with a petty apology was beyond me. I will never come back to this establishment. Im afraid of what I might see in my food so PLEASE CHECK YOUR FOOD BEFORE CONSUMING.

This was an excellent experience. After beign greeted warmly, we waited for about 30 minutes. We were then seated and drink orders placed and fresh complimentary bread was served. The service was fabulous. He friendly, engaging and attentive  and answered allll the questiosn we asked. We order the buffalo chicken blasts as an app. These were tasty and slightly spicy, deep fried bites. <br>Then came the lousiana style chicken and pasta dish. parmesan crusted chicken, with crunchy exterioer and moist meat. The bow tie spicy has a spicy cream sauce that really hit the spot, a definate comfort food. And of course, the cheescake. The dutch apple pie cheescake was fantastic. It was sweet and soft and bursting with fresh apples and spices

I have been coming to this location for years. The wait staff have always been courteous, congenial and attentive. I have only ever witnessed management work with and solve  customer concerns/complaints with  grace, compassion and a willingness to listen. The menu is extensive and provides option for any palate or dietary need. Being from NH and driving here has continually resulted in positive experiences.

Okay...we only got appetizers.  4 of them and they were delicious but seriously overpriced.  An avocado costs about $1.25, the wrapper even less.  $13 isn&#39;t justifiable.  The firecracker salmon was kinda gross but I&#39;m spoiled because I make my own, 4 days a week. The pork belly sliders are AMAZING. I don&#39;t like fried pickles but they work really well on these little beauties. <br><br>If you can, AVOID THE COFFEE!! Although delicious,  they have a nerve to charge $3.25 a cup.  If you can eat cheesecake without coffee,  do it so you don&#39;t throw up when you get the bill.  2 of us,  4 shared appetizers,  $100. Ridiculous!! How about losing the long,  intricately decorated benched hallway and pass the savings onto the customers? <br><br>They won&#39;t give a rat&#39;s ass about this review cuz they&#39;re always packed.  If you&#39;re loaded and pretentious,  go for it! The food&#39;s pretty decent,  but I won&#39;t go back anytime soon.

I just got home from picking up take out from this location tonight and cannot believe I paid $17.95 for the steak medallions! Literally, three, very SMALL pieces of steak were in this meal. Definitely not enough food for a grown, male adult. My fiancé was still hungry after eating it. Initially when I called to place my order, I asked them if they had steak tips and told me this dish was the closet thing to it. So, I went with their recommendation and ordered it. Little did I know, I was going to get ripped off. <br><br>Additionally, they previously forgot to package our cheesecakes and I had to wait a week to be sent a gift card for reimbursement.  <br><br>Becoming very disappointed with the quality and prices of this establishment.

We came in at 9pm on a Friday night and only ordered cheesecake to go. There was no line when ordering, but man this took forever. I don&#39;t understand how it takes more than 15 minutes to put cheesecake in a box. If the cheesecake wasn&#39;t so good I wouldn&#39;t come back, but the cheesecake is so damn good.

Its been a while since I came to this place. I went during lunch time. So it wasn&#39;t so busy. We sat at a booth and were treated with courtesy.  The waitress was nice to us. Food was good and never disappoints. I give it a four stars, it takes a long time to go thru their menu. It&#39;s too confusing. Lunch should have only lunch proportions and same with dinner and breakfast.<br><br>Their cheesecakes are wonderful!!!
Being busy doesn&#39;t mean that they can be sloppy in bringing food and make an excuse that they are busy<br>Bad experience overall
Huge menu selection<br>Great &#34;skinny&#34; menu<br>Large portions<br>I can ALWAYS count on a good meal from here...and of course excellent dessert.

Never have any issues when I come here. Of course it&#39;s usually a long wait especially on the weekends but I don&#39;t mind! The brunch menu and food are sooooo goood! I am still trying a lot of their menu options but it&#39;s hard since I sometimes want to get the same thing over and over again. My favorites are buffalo blast (app) (HUGE) Louisiana Chicken Pasta, Chicken Belagio, Thai lettuce wrap and the bacon bacon burger !! Those are some of my faves. And as if this visit I have two new favorites. Avocado Eggrolls and the herb crusted filet of salmon! So amazing. Our waitress was really nice I&#39;m not sure why people complain about a big menu. Everything is so good you can&#39;t go wrong.

Phenomenal! I have never sent food back but my steak was over cooked, not only did the waitress immediately and respectfully replace my meal she offered me a salad while I waited. Then the manager came over to personally apologize. This, mind you, was all during a lunch rush. <br><br>This has always been our go-to for snowy days, but now how could I go to another Cheesecake Factory?!? 5-stars!!!

My mother and I just was craving for a good pasta and a piece of good cheesecake so we decided to order by calling in our order. The person picking up the phone sounded very tired and annoyed that another order was being called in.... He told us we only had to wait for 15 to 20 mins. When we had arrived it was passed 15 mins and we paid for our meal and had to continue on waiting... It was a busy night but the cashier was really rude and throwing us our bill... so when he threw it the paper fell at his own feet.... and he just basically threw back the bill at us... after signing it he didn&#39;t even mention when the food will come out so I just waiting 10 more mins and tried to ask him but he just ignored me and said he can help the next in line.... so I waited in the line again to ask when our food will come out.... and when finally it was my turn he just gave me the worst glare and reluctantly wanted to answer my question..... and he just said bluntly 5mins.... and just brushed  me off.... my mother was pretty annoyed at this time so she just left the restaurant and I had waited in total 45mins for my food to come out..... When it came out he just called out my name and left not asking if I needed more utensils..... he was the most rudest cashier person I have ever experienced.

I waited over 40 minutes for my meal and wasn&#39;t offered even a discount or free dessert. Very disappointed that it took so long even though I was dining alone. My meal- beer battered fish tacos- was ok, a lot of bread though. Not worth the $20 after tax and tip.
BUGS in the food. Little black bugs crawling on every inch of my meal. How was that served to me? I am begging the corporate to check out this location good. This is un acceptable.

Went there tonight. The silverware was dirty the food tasted like it came from a frozen dinner or airport food this has to be the worst cheesecake Factory i have been to. My water cup had something floating in it when arrived on my table. The silver was placef on the dirty table. I don&#39;t know who in their right mind would eat at this location!

Grill bristle found in my food. I had to request the bartender 3 times to cash me out. After the 3rd she said she would be right with me and proceeded to leave the bar to check on food. Prioritize. Dirty as all get out. So dirty. Don&#39;t go.

I dine her every year and only have had one bad experience. The menu is very extensive and so much to choose from but always like to have the avocado spring rolls for my meal these last fews trips. Every year I get the Black Friday deal of gifts cards online and receiving two free slices for free. Amazing deal and this means I have to make the trip twice a year to get my cheesecake. Pretty much have had almost every cheesecake on the menu so far. Disappointed that Chris&#39;s Outrageous cheesecake is gone. Was always my favorite since it had so many different yummy things in it like chocolate, and many different candies, and so much more. Other then that I enjoy this place and really can&#39;t be beat for the cheesecakes.

I always have a good experience at the Cheesecake Factory and specially come here for the fried Mac and cheese balls. This particular Cheesecake Factory has a very long wait at times. The weekends are the worst and you could find yourself waiting for sometimes close to two hours.

Sadly I won&#39;t be returning, I love the Cheesecake Factory but a bad experience from eating a salad and getting food poisoning (E. Coli?) has just turned me off completely. I hadn&#39;t had anything to eat that day besides a quarter of the large salad I ordered, after lunch 10-20 mins later I had started to feel sick in the mall &amp; had to rush home. I was out for a couple days after. Completely disgusted.

I would give zero stars if I could. There were two of us. We waited a full hour to get a table even though there were several tables open outside and the outdoor area was being served. After we sat down, we knew what we wanted by then so ordered right away. We ordered 3 Apps to share. It literally (no lie nor exaggeration) took one entire hour for our 3 Apps to arrive (sliders, avocado egg rolls and crab bites). Never again. The food is decent, but it ain&#39;t worth waiting two hours for!! I honestly won&#39;t go to Burlington Cheesecake Factory ever again. They ruined what was supposed to be a nice evening. AN HOUR TO GET 3 APPETIZERS TO THE TABLE?!??????

Food is just ok.  Pretty low average. Burger was over cooked and fries were lukewarm and not fresh. Tallish woman with blond ponytail was our server. Slow slow slow. Took 13 min to pack up our leftovers.  We left unsatisfied with meal and terrible lackluster service. Avoid.

10/01/2018 Had lunch today and while the food was okay the service was fantastic. Briana was my server. She was professional, friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. Very much appreciated the service.

MOLD ON THE BREAD. I went here with my wife and daughter and right from the get go the bread was stale and when I picked it up there was a big spot of mold on it. The server was very apologetic and when the manager came over she apologized but her demeanor sounded like she was used to getting complaints all the time. I was too damn hungry to go anywhere else at that point and ate my food, which gave me a stomach ache and made me sick. Terrible

No thank you I ain&#39;t going to waste my time on the situation on what happend there&#39;s no point Lucas manager is rude and mean and disrespectful especially the girl host also never coming back here again especially my friends and family unacceptable

Today I walked in with a coworker at opening 11am, we ordered an appetizer that took 20 min to come out. I don&#39;t think guacamole should take 20 mins. At the time we ordered our appetizers we also ordered our meals (lettuce wraps and artichoke, and sandwich). We waited and waited and waited.... after a hour and 20mins we decided we were not going to wait any longer. We walked up to the front desk and asked for our check. I explained to the manager, Lori what had happened. She quickly grabbed my CC and charge my card for our $13 guacamole. Go somewhere else if you expect any type of customer service. This was a horrible experience and I will not be returning and I suggest choosing a different restaurant! UNLESS.... you want horrible service and you also want to leave hungry. Icing on the cake was when Lori didn&#39;t offer to comp our appetizer since our service was so horrible. Definitely won&#39;t be returning! Lost my business forever.... and I suggest you also find a different place to dine. We headed over Legal Seafood on the other side of the mall and the service was incredible! Highly suggest Legal Seafood!<br><br>After receiving a response from The Cheesecake Factory I have reached out on their website. Let wait some more a see if we get a response.

Got to the restaurant 55 minutes prior to closing and was still treated as if I got there during the day...never been to this location and it was pretty good. Waitress was nice and food was bomb! Although the only thing is the drinks here they barely put alcohol in it and wayyyyy to much ice.

This was my first ever visit to a Cheesecake Factory for a meal. The experience was quite great. They don&#39;t do reservations but we didn&#39;t have to wait to be seated. They have outdoor seating as well. Our server was polite and nice. We ordered Chicken Lettuce Wrap (Mexican), Eggplant Parmesan and White Chicken Chilli. All of the dishes were great and I really liked the White Chicken Chilli in particular. My first experience was great and I am glad that the dishes I chose turned out to be great. I am going there again...
Great food,friendly staffs,reasonable price!! My usual place to the kids out for the weekend...

Visited the Cheesecake factory with my mom and future sisters-in-law. It was a very busy lunchtime and took a while for our drink orders to come around. <br>I got the chipotle chicken pasta and was really disappointed with the three small diced pieces of chicken that were in the whole dish. What chicken was there was spicy and well-deserved, but for a 12.95 lunch order, I was disappointed! <br>Bathrooms were very clean. Decor is the same as the rest of the Cheesecake chain, which I don&#39;t really understand, but I guess I don&#39;t have to! <br>I&#39;m sure I&#39;ll be back to another Cheesecake Factory, I just hope to have a better dish!

The menu is way too extensive and overwhelming, that the wait staff doesn&#39;t know how to describe dishes because they are unfamiliar with the products. When I asked for a new knife (it was smudged and sticky), it took them 20 minutes and two requests. These encounters happened throughout my meal. <br><br>About a quarter of their items on the menu aren&#39;t even in stock. I went to this location about 3 months ago and they didn&#39;t have the Tuna Tartare. I went again yesterday and they still didn&#39;t restock the item because &#34;fish prices went up&#34;. If things aren&#39;t in stock, take it off your menu!! <br><br>The wait is usually about a half an hour, and the waiting area is very disorganized and dysfunctional. How hard is it to invest in some buzzers for patrons to hold while waiting?<br><br>The food was average, and decently overpriced. If you&#39;re looking for a good place to have a quiet conversation and attentive wait staff, skip this location.

The Cheesecake Factory is the common denominator when you have a large group of people to entertain with vastly different tastes. As the chain is billed to have the usual American-style food with twists on various cultural dishes, it&#39;s broadly got something for everyone.<br><br>Our latest visit was just after a morning of shopping, so it was righteous to treat ourselves to a decent meal to refuel before the next round. The bf and I arrived just after 2pm, and were seated promptly despite a bustling floor. We were assigned a waitress named Cassandra, and found that the menus we were given were all new. It&#39;s been awhile since I&#39;ve seen clean menus and new items here.<br><br>So we sat and ordered our rounds of water. We promised Cassandra we would be ready within five minutes to place our order. She returned to our table after 15 minutes; had we not had bread on the table, we probably would have keeled over from low blood sugar. Her lack of enthusiasm for the job really set the tone for the rest of the meal; the expectation bar fell pretty low.<br><br>I ended up ordering the lunch portion of the chicken piccata, while the bf ordered the chipotle chicken sandwich. Another 20 minutes later, our food arrives. At least Cassandra checked on us within 10 minutes of our eating. The food was good, and as usual, very large in quantity.<br><br>By the time we were close to done, the bf asked her for the check so we could escape, especially since we had already been seated for over an hour for what we thought would be a brief lunch. Another 10 minutes pass us by.<br><br>I keep holding onto the hope that speedy service exists here, only to have them repeatedly dashed. Now I remember why I don&#39;t come here as often.
The cheesecake here is delicious and their service is excellent. I ordered a cheesecake on Valentine&#39;s Day and they sent in a complimentary chocolate wishing happy Valentine&#39;s.

After 25 minutes and 8 phone calls my food is still not out at curbside to go. It took 4 calls to get someone to pickup the phone.  The next person took my cake pay number and said the food would be right out.  10 mins more and no food.  Called again and it&#39;s been about 8 mins with no luck.  I like their food but this is ridiculous.   Finally went in to get the food and waiting inside. By the time we got the food it  was cold of course.  Not acceptable to order at 6:30, promise the food in 30 mins and not get it until 8pm

I used to love this place.... They don&#39;t take reservations.  There is seating in bar area. You  are quoted a twenty minute wait but it can be an hour.  What perplexes me  is there are always plenty of empty tables. The staf<br>f is average at best.  I often get their Louisiana Chicken Pasta.  They give you a lot of chicken.  It&#39;s actually a good meal to split with an extra side of pasta and some side salads. The cheesecake was good but took it to go.

In my experience the Italian food here is great but I was really disappointed to get a Shepherd&#39;s pie full of burnt ground beef the other night.  Of course it happened on a night I was doing take-out and with my two kids I don&#39;t have time to go back and complain.  I will say that the Tito&#39;s &amp; Lemonade I had while waiting for the food was excellent.

I&#39;ve always had great experiences here!<br><br>- Portions are ENORMOUS. Including the desserts, so it justifies $8. <br>- Consistent good servers. <br>- Good bread before the meal. <br>- Pretty design &amp; decor<br><br>Only downside is they don&#39;t take reservations or call ahead seating, so peak dinner times and weekends get busy!

First, we had to wait over half an hour for a table and then were told they &#34;forgot&#34; to ring the buzzer. Then we were seated right in the middle of everyone in a very cramped space. We then got a really awful waiter who didn&#39;t seem to care about the service. He took forever getting us drinks let alone some bread to snack on. The water tasted awful so don&#39;t even bother. Our food took quite awhile to come out which wasn&#39;t a huge bother. It was actually very good I got the Truffle Honey Chicken and my boyfriend got the Bacon Bacon Burger which he said was good but didn&#39;t sit too well. We ended up getting cheesecake to go after being there for 2 hours. When it came to paying I ended up getting shorted $1.05 in change but was over it so we just ended up leaving without leaving a tip. The whole time we were there we watched all of the people around us getting great service and coming in and out much faster than us. I&#39;m just really disappointed because this was both of our first time at the Cheesecake Factory and it was my boyfriends birthday and we aren&#39;t rude or particular people at all.

1 star, only because I had to choose at least 1. Had an amazing lunch here on a Thursday with my whole team from work. My husband and I thought we would give dinner another try, which ended up being a big mistake and on my Birthday.. waitress  was rude got drink order wrong and brought my husbands coke to the table even though it looked like water with a splash of syrup in it, it should have Never left the bar that way never mind been left at our table. Then the waitress went to take our order. She took out paper and just looked at me... so i proceed to order.. she never wrote either order down. She came back to the table 3 times.. 1st to check how he wanted the potato, then to check how the vegetable was cooked, and the 3rd time to see how the steak was supposed to be cooked...someone else brought the meals to the tabled.. just dropped them and walked away.. never asked him to check the steak or if we needed anything else... what we actually needed was dinner somewhere else... steak was completely burnt on the outside and raw inside.. my pasta was hard, clumped together and not cooked.. there was also 3 tiny shrimp in my plate and the rest was pasta.. not acceptable told the waitress about my pasta and she laughed and said she would tell the kitchen.  Told the manager not to bother making another plate because I was no longer hungry. and I wasnt paying for these plates.

I usually never have a problem eating here. Last night I went in with a friend and we were seated less than ten mins of going in around close to 6pm. The waitress that we had made the whole experience terrible. She brought our waters forgetting the lemon that we asked, we let it slide in the beginning. We ordered a bottle of wine before our food and then ordered our food. She came with the bottle of wine and took our order. She did not open the bottle in front of us like she&#39;s supposed to nor did she pour the wine for us. The wine glasses were so dirty as well. When ordering my steak Diane, she did not ask me how I wanted my steak. She looked like she was rushing so I needed up slipping in on how I wanted my steak and I said medium please. We let that slide again and poured the wine for ourselves. She brought the bread and we waited for our food. While we were waiting for our food, we asked for the lemons again for our water. Our food came out and still no lemons. So we asked for it the third time and she gave it to us apologizing.<br><br>When our food came out the steak was well done... again, because we were hungry we let it slide again. We were only ten mins into our food and our plates were still pretty full, however, she gave us our check and told us to take our time. Usually wait staff only does this if their shift is ending and need to check out. But she didn&#39;t mention anything about her shift ending... we were confused and very annoyed. She came back while we were still eating (our plates still had a good amount of food and we were still eating) and asked us if we were done and wanted boxes?! If we didn&#39;t touch our plates then I&#39;d understand, but not even 30 plus minutes passed. At this point we were super disappointed and mad.<br><br>We wanted to order another bottle of wine. She brought it to us again already opened and did not pour for us..... she was the worst waitress I&#39;ve ever had and the worst experience I had combining all the and experiences. Either she needs to be re-trained or terminated. Everything she was doing was not properly trained, rushed and did however she wanted.<br><br>I wish I had called the manager at this point but because it was so busy I just let it slide. It&#39;s not like I was in the most high end restaurant. But the service was still unacceptable.

Ok, so this place seems to be going downhill. Decided to give another shot at it and was hugely dissatisfied....1st food was late, Mgr came over and apologized briefly, no reason....then when it did arrive, my sons burger and bun were burnt and my wife&#39;s chicken Madeira as well...all we got was free cheesecake 2 pieces, which I had to wait 20 minutes for...yeah so not visiting anymore...such a shame used to be a fan of this place, Applebees would of been better tonight.

Chain restaurant located at Burlington Mall conveniently located off 128/95. Menu book contains countless options (vegetarian, salads, meats, sandwiches, desserts, brunch) that makes you wonder how they can possibly churn them all out to keep ingredients fresh. We come for exactly this variety, but order the same things. Quality is hot and cold, just like the service. Tables and menus could use some cleaning. Food pricing is a great value. During peak hours (4-8 pm, 11:00 am-1:30 pm) and weekends, be prepared to wait 45-90 minutes.
Got to the cheesecake at 2 pm. Got a beer and a mojito 21.52. Been waiting for a hour. No seating yet. Time to leave. Sorry not good

Went here recently with my girlfriend and her family on a weekend afternoon and it was incredibly busy. The wait wasn&#39;t too bad, though. Probably 10-15 minutes.<br><br>As always, I was overwhelmed by their menu, which seems like it&#39;s 50 pages and I&#39;m sure most of those items never get ordered. <br><br>Our server was very patient with our large group and provided excellent service throughout.<br><br>I ordered the Grilled Chicken and Avocado Club with no bacon (chicken, avocado, tomato, swiss, mayo). It was fine. Tasty and a bit messy. Probably not worth the price, but not bad. One of the people in the group was dissatisfied with her Cobb Salad, so I offered her the other half of my sandwich, and she really enjoyed it. The fries were good as well.<br><br>For dessert, we got the Oreo dream Extreme Cheesecake, which was really disappointing. It&#39;s a base layer of fudge cake, then a middle layer of their original cheesecake with Oreos baked in, then a layer of Oreo cookie mousse, topped with milk chocolate icing. I&#39;m an Oreo fan, but nothing about it stood out to me. The cake was pretty cold (must have just come out of the fridge), so it wasn&#39;t very moist. The original cheesecake layer wasn&#39;t anything special to me, either. The best layer seemed to be the Oreo mousse, but I got sick of that quickly because it was so sweet. Wouldn&#39;t order again.<br><br>Overall, not worth the price.

I usually don&#39;t write reviews for big chain restaurants. However, I was thoroughly impressed by my recent dining experience at Cheesecake Factory because of the wonderful service!<br><br>I went on a weekday night and it was not too busy. I ordered chicken scampi and chicken lettuce wrap for appetizers. The food was delicious! The lettuce wrap was refreshing. It was served with grilled chicken, pickled cucumbers, julienned carrots, cold noodles, and comes with 3 sauces. Each sauce was very tasty. The chicken scampi was also very good. The pasta was al dente! I hate when my pasta is overcooked. The scampi sauce was garlicky and delicious. It had the perfect balance of acidity and savory mixed together. <br><br>The service was absolutely wonderful! The waitress who served our table was a lovely lady. She was very attentive and served us right away, even though she was juggling with several other tables. She made sure our drinks were filled. Because the table for 2 was too small for all of our dishes, she even went to the extent to push the table next to us over, so we had more space. It is service like this that brings people back! Unfortunately, I forgot her name, otherwise I would give her a special shoutout!

Very satisfied <br>When entering the maitre-d&#39; initially notified me that the wait was about 10 minutes. However we were literally called to be seated with in about 5 minutes. Once seated our waiter was Penny. With all of the busy-ness of the restaurant ( considering it was Friday night). I witnessed Penny be attentive to all of her tables that she waited. She checked on everyone and made sure everyone is alright (I&#39;m a firm believer in tipping  a waiter/waitress not just on how they treat me but how they treat others). Penny was kind and wholesome. <br><br>On to the food.<br>-portions were perfectly sized <br>-drinks were great and well made (i had a Caribbean cooler, my sister had a lemon drop)<br>-had a starter salad (spicy Caesar Salad, it was huge it was definitely  too much for 1 person but just enough for 2 people to share as well as great, I wouldn&#39;t refer to it as spicy but it was flavorful) <br>-i ordered the tomato basil pasta and my sister ordered the spicy chicken chipolte pasta (both flavorful) <br>-dessert-lemoncello cream torte (absolutely wonderful)

This was my first time at any Cheesecake Factory and I had a wonderful experience. The food was better than expected. I will order the same pasta again, because it was absolutely tasty. There&#39;s also a large variety of Cheesecake to choose from. Trying a new desert next time is a must! I also loved the friendliness among the staff. They were responsible and kind. The atmosphere was beautiful as well. I will most definitely come to this location again! Five stars!

It&#39;s a chain type restaurant so I didn&#39;t really expect anything great. The waitress forgot us multiple times and it took forever to get drinks. The wait for food was even longer and then they &#34;forgot &#34;to make the spaghetti for my daughters chicken parm. Everything came out separately with no rhyme or reason and some of the dishes had stuff on them that was cold and clearly had been waiting for other things. I&#39;d recommend getting to go or just finding someplace else that&#39;s comparable in price because it&#39;s not worth what you pay for mediocre service/food!

Reservations.  Please give more info on time.    I had called to reserve a table for 10. I was told they don&#39;t make reservations after 11am? And this was for 2:30pm. I called at 11:05am.  On yelp,  it says reservations....
Was there Sunday night about 7:00pm they were busy,<br>I ordered shrimp pasta and some app, the pasta was little to hard but everything was good.

Great food, friendly staff, convenient location, and excellent value. No complaints here. My friend and I came here for lunch right when they opened so there was no wait. They have a large menu with so many tasty sounding options. <br><br>I opted for the macaroni and cheese burger which is basically a huge burger cooked to order, topped with one of their fried mac n cheese balls, sitting under more melted cheese. If you haven&#39;t guessed it already, it&#39;s one heck of diet bomb but it&#39;s so amazing. The mac n cheese ball comes out fresh from the fryer with a nice crunchy crust so when you put the top bun on top and press down, there&#39;s an audible cracking sound before the ooey gooey mac n cheese starts oozing out all over the burger. <br><br>I ordered a salad on the side instead of fries (though I held no illusions that this was an even remotely healthy meal) and ended up only eating half of my burger. Their portions are almost comically large so it&#39;s not always easy to save room for dessert. I managed to save a little bit of room and ordered a slice of the reese&#39;s peanut butter chocolate cake cheesecake. It was amazing though it was a similarly huge portion size so I took half of it home with me. <br><br>In the end, I had another meal&#39;s worth of leftovers, all for a very reasonable price.

Don&#39;t look down! I went there on Thursday evening and the floor was disgusting. Appearances and first impressions are everything and immediately I was turned off. The floor looked like it hadn&#39;t been swept in weeks. We had a gentleman server who was very nice and the food was good.....but it was tough to stomach anything after the surroundings and utensils were dirty. Just be aware of the cleanliness when you arrive.

Cheesecake amazing. We come all the time. Today they were packed so let&#39;s give them the benefit of doubt. My husbands fish was hard, over cooked. And full of oil. He did not eat it. We knew that it was not going to be done again considering we waited an hour to be seated. My garden salad came as a Cesar salad. Which I won&#39;t cry because I love every salad. They did wipe out my husbands meal because he did not touch it. They also did well sending the kitchen staff/ manager out. The food is usually amazing but two mess ups on 1 order is not acceptable.
Both times, food is blech but the service lacks! Both times management and service is rude

Poor service at lunch today. Simple requests, such as asking for hot sauce, took ten minutes with my food getting cold, until the server finally appeared having obviously waited to combine it with items for other tables. I sat with an empty coffee cup for twenty minutes, as no one offered a refill. <br><br>One bad waitress or a pattern of bad management? It&#39;s hard to say. <br><br>As for the food, an omelette overcooked and leathery, probably because it sat on the steam table until the server felt in the mood to bring it. <br><br>This place needs to clean up its act.

I&#39;m normally a fan of Chesecake Factory, but lately I&#39;ve been getting very frustrated with them. The last few times I&#39;ve ordered takeout it&#39;s taken forever for someone to just get on the phone to take my order. Then I have to wait for my order for a solid 10 mins once I get there and my food is then cold. The last two times they&#39;ve also screwed up my order. Will think twice about ordering here in future and will go somewhere else where they have their act together!
It doesn&#39;t matter if it&#39;s takeout, or eat in, the service at this location is a nightmare.

Came in at five, was told 20-30 minute wait. Got sat five minutes after six. Our server Shelly was neglectful the whole night. Forgot my water and my friends root beer. Our main course came in the middle of all of us eating our appetizers which was super annoying. Ordered a rare steak, it came medium well. We sat for over a half an hour while we waited for a dessert menu. But of course she was quick and prompt when we needed our bill. It&#39;s a bummer because normally this place is great.
The food was delicious and the service was great! a great experience all around. my new fav

Love this place for a reliable meal.  You can count on the fact that there is something that everyone will enjoy and the food is delish.  I especially enjoy the skinnylicious asian chicken salad...and the brown bread they give you for FREE!  <br><br>This location does tend to get super busy because of the mall so plan accordingly.

Tuesday night. 7:50pm. I&#39;m bolting for the bathroom feeling nauseas. <br><br>Wait. Let me rewind......<br><br>My mom was treating me to dinner for being such a great daughter. We ordered delicious strawberry lemonades, warm crab &amp; artichoke dip and BBQ salmon.<br><br>Everything was good-except for the salmon. About 1/2 way through it(at 7:50pm) I started feeling light headed, hot, and nauseas.
