Not knowing why, I wrapped the rest of the food to go.<br><br>The next day my mom ate the leftover salmon &amp; had the same symptoms.<br><br>I always order the bbq salmon &amp; have never experienced this reaction before. Now I&#39;m scared to ever order it again!!!<br><br>P.S-Our waiter Jensen was great.

Almost had a coronary due to the high saturated fat content, I could feel my heart clenching, I broke out into a cold sweat and it felt like I had a stomach full if cement. <br><br>This was when I opened the menu, I had yet to try the food.<br><br>Calorie counting and slim waistlines take a backseat to deep fried and over sauced selections from around the globe. <br><br>The voluminous menu makes certain there&#39;s a selection (usually multiple)  for every taste. <br><br>I made the mistake of checking nutritional data prior to my arrival and if i were to indulge I&#39;d have to shame myself in the same manner you criticize someone who smokes while reading the box that&#39;s informing them they&#39;re killing themselves by using this product. <br><br>Remedial calculations for an app, average meal and the obvious need for a cheesecake slice to bookend my experience put my calories around 5500. <br><br> I&#39;d assume I&#39;d need the assistance of NASA to determine how many sit-ups I&#39;d need to do to work off the calories in a bistro shrimp pasta. <br><br>I had a diet coke and split.  The soda was ice cold and satisfactory. No medicinal phenolic taste you generally get from some fountain beverages.

i am beyond furious and frustrated by my experience here. i had an allergic reaction here, even after i told the waitress about ALL of my allergies. here&#39;s the story:<br><br>my boyfriend and i came here for a date night on Tuesday May 15, 2018. it was around 8:30pm. the waitress was very sweet and nice, and we ordered the wuesadilla with chicken. it was decent, and i really liked the green sauce it came with (guac? look at pics). i ordered a simple steak with green beans and mashed potatoes, as i got the last time i came here. (boyfriend ordered orange chicken which he liked. said it was airy. refer to photos). <br><br>about my dish.. the green beans came out with a ton of char on them (refer to photo) but i didn&#39;t seem to think twice about it since i told the waitress about all of my allergies and asked her to tell the cooks to use a new pan for me. but after taking a bite of one green bean, i immediately got an allergic reaction. my mouth started to swell at a fast rate, my tongue extremely itchy, and my mouth became all red (and you could even see it through my foundation!). i immediately took 2 pills of benadryl. i still felt like crap, so i took a third. thank god it helped. my boyfriend and i talked about it and he told me it must be from seafood they cooked or something else i&#39;m allergic to that they reused the pan for my green beans.. that made perfect sense. i love green beans and have no allergy to them. after this whole incident, it took the waitress an additional 5-7 minutes to check upon us and the food. i told her about my reaction. she just apologized and said she&#39;d get me a new bowl of green beans (and told me to give her the green beans i currently had on my plate. what???? i was very confused at that). i said no, just give me steamed broccoli instead because i was afraid i would get another reaction. i had absolutely no problem the first time i ordered this dis and told them about my allergies. what happened?!<br><br>she got me the broccoli, apologized, and we finished our meal. she didn&#39;t even compensate our meal, nor offer a free dessert.. nothing at all. she was very kind though, so we still tipped her graciously, but i was beyond disappointed. that experience was horrific, and i will not be going here ever again!! not after i nearly had to go to the hospital because of them and was not even compensated for THEIR mistake!

Bistro Shrimp Pasta for take out was terrible. The dish was filled with oil that was pooling at the bottom of the takeout container. The shrimp was super dry - texture was not fresh shrimp, nor thawed frozen shrimp... Just super dehydrated tough shrimp. The menu mentioned artichoke, but there were not visible bits of artichoke. Skip this dish unless you are eating in and can send it back, if it&#39;s like this as well.

I&#39;ve been to this particular location for many years and haven&#39;t had a problem, ever.<br><br>The food is consistent: in terms of portion size, quality and taste.<br><br>I would definitely recommend this location!

The only redeeming quality is this place, this thing they call a sit down customer service restaurant is that it&#39;s open late. We left AMC movies across the street and it was late. <br><br>We opted for the only thing we found open and this did not disappoint. We got ALL the filth, booth filled of bread crumbs, sticky table (not resin like the table cleaning boy said) and crappy customer service you would expect and need for up to a year! But something has drastically changed in this place and I&#39;ve figured it out from past recent reviewers. The management no longer cares. The inmates are running the asylum. I asked our waiter &#34;Pete&#34; for a manager and he laughed.. walked away and a manager NEVER came. <br><br>I wish I could like this location. I like the CF on huntington Ave but this falls really short of a go to location for anything.

Cheesecake Factory!! What a disappointment. Food was just awful! Steak needs to be removed off menu if your going to serve &#34;shoe leather&#34;. Tap water needs to be cold not warm. Service with a smile goes a long way and clean utensils would be nice!! What happened to this place!!

I am a little torn because in reality the food is  3 star quality and the cheesecake is 5 star quality. I suppose that averages out to 4 stars.<br><br>A friend and I came to this location yesterday. We were seated in under 15 minutes even though it was Black Friday and the mall was packed. (Granted there was only two of us and we didn&#39;t show up until around 2:30 pm). Overall the service was prompt and friendly.<br><br>We got some fresh bread to start which was pretty average for free starter bread (though the pumpernickel was definitely the better of the two). The lunch special chicken fettuccine with sun dried tomatoes I ordered was good (not bad or great) though I will say that despite being a lunch portion I could only finish half of it - very heavy! Good thing too since even as a lunch special it was still $12.50.<br><br>We didn&#39;t end up getting any cheesecake this time (except for the free raspberry white chocolate sample which was delicious!) but I&#39;ve gotten cheesecake here several times and every time it&#39;s been delicious! My favorite is definitely the dulce de leche although the Tiramisu is quite good too!<br><br>I would only eat here if I was at the mall for another reason or if I was craving some really good cheesecake!

Horrible service, I had an reservation for 5:00pm for 8 people, so I got there 5:05 myself and the rest of the party was 3 min away, so I asked them to make me sit because I wanted to order some food, so they didn&#39;t let me to sit and they said they have to cancel my reservation if in three minutes are the people are not there, so not professional and that&#39;s not how you treat your customers

Problem with their phone lines and luck of professional stuff!!<br>Ok so this is my 4 th time calling them for order to go. They couldn&#39;t connect the lines! At last I was transferred and woman when complained she couldn&#39;t hear me when all my reception was 5 bars.<br>Then she could not understand when I asked her question about meat. What a waste of time.<br>Please train the staff to know the phones and the menu!!

My best friend and I really love this place but don&#39;t come here as often as we would like because it&#39;s really pricey. We always love coming here because the food is delicious and the quality is always consistent.<br><br>We got the avocado rolls as appetizers and as usual, they&#39;re yummy and filling. With those on top of the bread basket though, it&#39;s really easy to get full so you might want to skip on the appetizer if you want to make room for your entree and dessert. I got the Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pasta as my entree, my usual, and only ate half because I wanted to save room for dessert. I took out the other half for leftovers since leftovers from Cheesecake Factory are still good. Since it was an early dinner and since we ate so much, we didn&#39;t get dessert which we both ended up regretting! Make room for dessert! <br><br>Our waiter was Jack P, if I recall correctly, and his service was pretty standard. We weren&#39;t sure if he was a little down because it was so busy or if it was because we ordered water (waiters assume you won&#39;t tip generously because you ordered water). We honestly ordered water because we already had a sugary drink right before. Since it was the holiday season and because my best friend is a waiter, we tipped Jack P more than we normally would. Cheer up Jack P! <br><br>We&#39;ll definitely be back again.

Egg roll sampler is the bomb!  Chicken Marsala w/ mushrooms was ok, but nothing to write home about.  Overall, this place is good.  Cheesecake of course is the whole reason to visit this place but not if you&#39;re on a diet.  :-)

This is one of our favorite places to sit, eat, and eat cheese cake of course. My favorite of the moment is the dulce de leche cheese cake, and my fiancé&#39;s is the vanilla bean cheesecake. The wait on weekends can be a little crazy, and there&#39;s not much sitting room for parties that are waiting. So I don&#39;t recommend going here on those days if you don&#39;t like standing and waiting. But during the week, the wait is not bad, and usually we can get seated in a few minutes. Great mid week date spot.

Pretty solid spot. This location is nothing out of the ordinary for cheesecake factory so by me reviewing this one I&#39;m basically reviewing all of the locations I&#39;ve been to. It&#39;s an middle to upper tier restaurant that delivers a pretty good experience. Obviously the cheesecake is great and I enjoy most of the flavors. This particular location is really busy all of the time and you may experience lengthy waits and they don&#39;t allow reservations. The drinks here are really good I would recommend that you try them all!! No seriously, work your way down the drink menu and you will not be disappointed. All in all I would recommend this to anyone but cannot give it 5 stars because that would mean it is perfect.

We went here for my son&#39;s birthday and made a reservation which they do take before 5PM.  Parking is at the mall, at this time of day it wasn&#39;t too bad finding a spot but by the time we left the lot was completely full. <br><br>Very clean, stylish, romantic, A+++ service, very yummy cheese cake!  They bring out bread and butter which is very good.  I had my usual Sam Adams lager which was $8.25 (a little bit more in price than I&#39;m used to paying). <br><br>The menu can be a little bit daunting as it is very expansive.  The one thing that I can&#39;t put my finger on is that I don&#39;t have a favorite meal or every-time I come out of there say wow that was wonderful.  Maybe I haven&#39;t found it yet.  My daughter agrees with me too!     I had the Factory Burrito Grande!   It was served with yummy guacamole, sour cream and beans.  The problem with the burrito was WHERE&#39;s THE BEEF (or chicken rather).  It was all rice... very very disappointing.   Everyone else enjoy their meal or at least didn&#39;t say anything bad about it.  <br><br>The waiter was excellent... took our orders for the six of us by memory and never got it wrong. <br><br>I think this review is consistent with my other visits... nice place, great service, but the food isn&#39;t memorable and that makes me hesitant to go back.

I love Cheesecake. Having said that, I have been to many many different locations all over the US. This location is definitely one of my top 5. The food is always fresh and delicious and I have had nice and friendly staff wait on me every time I have been there. Always a safe option if you want some good food and don&#39;t want to break the bank! Good for families as well as parties!

The Good:  Arrived at 4:30 for early dinner and were seated immediately. <br>The Food:  Three out of four dishes were reported as very good.  The fourth had obviously completed it&#39;s cooking process early and &#34;waited&#34; for the rest of the order as it had cooled to room temp when served - very disappointing.  <br>The Bad:  Due to our early arrival, the place was very quiet. With that, our food took exceptionally long to reach the table after ordering.  Additionally, upon arrival, I had not entirely settled into my seat and noticed one of my Forks was coated with food debris.  My wife also noticed her knife was filthy dirty. The waitress was quick to replace our utensils with much apology.  Unfortunately this was not the last issue with silverware; with arrival of desert, my wife immediately dropped her spoon realizing it too was caked with leftover, hardened food - we grabbed a pic of it this time. A discussion with the Manager yielded a free piece of cheesecake.  Exiting the restaurant, we all wondered just how clean the rest of the silverware actually was - so far no illness but this drops my review to one-star without hesitation.<br>Conclusion:  I&#39;ve been to other Cheesecake Factory locations and they have been great experiences.  Late and cold food, coupled with highly suspect cleanliness makes me seriously question whether I&#39;ll revisit this location.

Lengthy menu but perfect food-<br>My fav. Picks<br>1.Chicken Romano<br>2. Pineapple chicken and shrimp<br>3. Jamaican meal<br>4. Bow tie pasta with chicken <br>5. Turkey burger<br>6. Obviously cheesecake--all the flavors

This location is the most convenient one for me  because it is so much easier to get to since it is right off of RT128.  Like all the other locations, it&#39;s got that nice decor with the high ceiling and very friendly and responsive staff in their white uniforms. <br><br>The food is good and the menu has a lot of options to chose from, but I have noticed that the portions have become much small than before and the prices are still the same.  <br><br>The drinks are very good, the bartenders are knowledgeable and they have a very good selection of spirits.  They also have a seasonal on tap all the time.<br><br>All in all a very nice place to come to for lunch or dinner.

We stopped in on a Saturday for lunch at the bar. Bar tender was great.<br>The food was all solid, like always, though for the price would like more.<br>We&#39;ve had the bang bang chicken/shrimp, fresh country salad, and tuna tateki salad: all were solid. <br>Bread and butter that come complementary are always excellent - I think the butter is made of sugar love.<br>The cheesecakes are so rich and luscious. LOVE THEM!

If I could give my experience zero stars I would. Where to begin, our experience started perfectly fine. There was a short wait, maybe five minutes or so, which was to be expected due to us going during the lunch rush. We were seated and given our menus and we were assured our waiter would be with us shortly. We decided on our drinks and our food and awaited our waiter. Fifteen minutes went by before anyone came to our table. Our waiter was polite and took our drink order and said he&#39;d get our food order when he came back. Another fifteen minutes went by and our drinks came over. I don&#39;t think a coke and a bud light would take fifteen minutes, but anyways. We placed the order for our appetizer and food. We waited and waited for our food or even for our waiter to come by and check on us and we could not find him. He came back over to the table and asked us what our appetizer was again and assured us it would be out soon. Another fifteen minutes went by and the appetizer finally came out, immediately followed by a cold plate of pasta and a soggy turkey club. Mind you that several people that were seated anywhere from ten to twenty minutes after us had ordered drinks and food, ate, paid, and left before we even received our food. I could only stomach a quarter of my soggy turkey club and the pasta that my fiancé ordered was cold to the point where it wasn&#39;t appetizing anymore. We each ate one of the cheeseburger spring roles that we ordered but pushed them aside because they were immediately followed by our food. I got up and spoke to a manager to who assured me that they would take care of me. So I went and sat back down and awaited the check. The waiter came over and delivered a half hearted apology and offered to buy us dessert. I refused because at that point it had been over an hour since we had been seated. The waiter brought the check over and when I opened it they still tried to charge me for the food we ate barely any of. I told them I was not paying for the food but I would pay for the drinks I ordered. He brought me back the check and I paid and left. This whole ordeal went on from 3:15 to about 4:30. And to top the whole ordeal off they damaged my debit card that I paid with, which I used at a store about ten minutes before and it worked fine, so now the chip is unreadable by other EFT machines and I have to order a new debit card. I&#39;ve eaten at this location of Cheesecake Factory before and had a poor experience each time. I gave it one more shot today and will never go there again, and I would not recommend this place to anyone I know.
Had lunch with my daughter there today and while we were eating a mouse ran under our table.  The manager asked if we would like to move  move but wasn&#39;t very apologetic.  We will not be back

Never had a bad meal here. LOVE how consistent the food is every time. Despite an issue with my meal at my last visit, management was AMAZINGLY nice and comped our entire meal! Unnecessary but greatly appreciated. <br><br>One handy tip: do not be scared by high calories count from dishes w/ dressings and sauces. Simply ask for a side dish and water down the dressing - a little goes a long way and it tastes exactly the same with some water added! Easy way to shave 2-400 calories off your meal!

So I&#39;ve been hearing about the Cheesecake Factory for years and tried one at the International Mall in Tampa ... not bad.<br><br>Yesterday, I ran into a high school friend at the Burlington Mall and we went to the local Cheesecake Factory for a quick dinner.  One of my worst dinner experience of the past year.<br><br>I was told the wait was going to be about 50 minutes and the &#34;beeper&#34; wouldn&#39;t work in the Mall.  Thinking we had at least 30 minutes to roam the mall before we had to be in &#34;beeper range&#34;, we ran over to the Apple Store for 15 minutes ... not good.  We got back to Cheesecake Factory 20 minutes after we left there and we had &#34;beeped&#34; in the meantime.<br><br>We solved that issue and were seated.  Fenway Park is somewhat quieter, but OK ... we&#39;re hungry.  The Server showed up, failed to identify himself and disappeared for 10 minutes.  Not very welcoming or professional, but we&#39;re here for the food, not to find quality staff.<br><br>I ordered the Chick Piccata, one of their &#34;specialties&#34;, according to their menu.  Fairly simple, right?  Apparently not.<br><br>The pasta was stone cold.   It wouldn&#39;t have been a big deal to send it back, but it took over 10 minutes for our &#34;server&#34; to show up and ask &#34;how&#39;s everything&#34;.   When he finally did show up, I sent the Chicken Picatta back.  Within 10 minutes, I was served another dish of Chicken Piccata, by someone I presume to be a &#34;manager&#34;.   No comment from the manager, she just delivered the meal.<br><br>It was hot this time, except the Pasta was under-done by a lot ... it wasn&#39;t edible.<br><br>The Chicken Picatta was in a word, disgusting.  The chicken was boiled, not pan cooked.   The sauce was an awful concoction of I&#39;m not sure what.  Traditional Chicken Piccata should have a lemon/butter/caper/mushroom sauce.  This had some weird, white sauce, that tasted and looked like it was made with milk or some such liquid.  I had 3 bites of the chicken and gave up.<br><br>Starving, I figured I need a dessert to fill me up.  The chocolate tuxedo cheesecake was great, but I wanted to have a cup of coffee to help wash it down.  Coffee is about the most basic beverage to serve and Cheesecake Factory couldn&#39;t even deliver the goods when it came to a cup of coffee.<br><br>The decaf coffee I was served was cold and must have been at least 4 hours old.  My spoon would almost stand up by itself, when I put in the cup.  I asked for &#34;cream &amp; sugar&#34; and I was served a small aluminum pitcher of what I suspect, was either milk or some reconstituted coffee lightener.  I took one sip of the coffee and nearly spit it across the table.  I hope after I left, they saved the coffee to use as a solvent to clean their floors, rather than waste it.<br><br>The Chocolate Tuxedo Cheesecake was excellent.<br><br>In retrospect, the next time I&#39;m hungry at the Burlington Mall, perhaps I&#39;ll just go to the Food Court, spent $5 there for some fast food and then go to Cheesecake Factory to get a dessert &#34;to go&#34;.    I&#39;d save $50 and not have to go home hungry.<br><br>How this restaurant chain is so successful, baffles me.  I guess it proves that most diners will eat dirt on a shingle and like it, as long as they&#39;re served a decent size portion.

Aside from the typical ginormous portion sizes and delectable cheesecake, this location is well run. The weekend can get very busy with every table occupied, and the staff remains friendly and at ease with the crowd. Impressive considering the clientele that a mall can bring in. I&#39;ve also been here after work for drinks and apps in the past, and the outdoor seating is pleasant on warmer days. <br>The drinks are good. Look out for the mango margarita! You will see an array of salads and &#39;healthy&#39; type apps and entrees on the menu, but if you are like me, you and your dining compadres will order all the things that will make you feel absolutely disgusted with yourself when you leave. For instance, the fried mac and cheese balls drenched in marinara sauce, or the avocado egg rolls... or the sweet corn tamale cakes! Delicious. Sure that Chinese chicken salad may look a little safer, but then you see that egg roll sampler drift by your table, and your mind is back to the fried Mac and cheese balls! If you don&#39;t have room for cheesecake, order it to go. You know... after you go for that run later... or after a nap! ;) <br>Lastly, the bathrooms are clean and I like that the music is turned up in the bathroom to void out other sounds...

Depending on the day/time the wait can be a bit ridiculous but helps that it&#39;s attached to the mall in that aspect. <br><br>Lunch and dinner menus are both HUGE so you&#39;d never be limited on what to choose from. Their patio is nice during the summer and inside seating is good too except some tables are very close to others. <br><br>ALWAYS get the cheesecake even if you don&#39;t have room for it, it isn&#39;t called the Cheesecake Factory for nothing!
Great spot for lunch at the mall. Nice atmosphere. Food was as expected. Good lunch specials. Cheesecake was delish LOL
I love this location. The service is always great, food is always hot, and cheesecake is delectable.
This place always has a wait   It&#39;s always crazy busy.  Tip go to Cambridge so much better.   Food is consistent drinks are good  lemon meringue cheesecake is to die for.

Took Beaver for lunch after hearing good things about this place from friends. <br>PRO-Got there early &amp; the place was dead, so we got seated right away. Yes, the menu is giant. Beaver got the chicken parm sandwich, Ward got the pineapple chicken &amp; shrimp &amp; a glass of wine. Both liked their food. Beav &amp; I stuck to Lemonade, which came with a nice sugar rim on the glass. Danny, our waiter was very nice &amp; brought out good crusty bread. The boys packed up their extra food &amp; each of them got a cheesecake piece for dessert later packed to go.<br>CON-My shrimp scampi was unusual &amp; not in a good way. Came with five decent sized but kinda mushy shrimp displayed on the sides of the giant plate with a scoop of angel hair pasta in the middle. There were whole roasted cloves of garlic scattered around &amp; some (I think) candied pecans(?) in the sauce that gave a weirdly sweet taste to the whole dish. I had to ask for some lemon slices to give it any kind of lemon taste. I ate it, but wouldn&#39;t order it again. The place is decorated with that &#34;Old Italian Church Fresco Ceiling&#34; look, cheesy for sure.<br>SO-I guess two outta three ain&#39;t bad, the boys liked it, but I won&#39;t be voting to go back anytime soon. Lunch was $93 before tip.Yikes! I totally don&#39;t get all the raves for this place. Mediocre sums it up for me in one word.

I visited your Natick location yesterday, Sunday, around 4 pm.  I had a very unpleasant experience for the first time.  I frequent this location a lot and this time was very different than others.  For starters they sat us at a table where underneath were leftover food and 2 utensils.  After that we ordered drinks and food simultaneously the first time our waiter came by to hopefully expedite the process plus I get the same thing every time so I don&#39;t need to browse the menu.  The drinks took a while to come and the food took way longer about 45 minutes if I had to guess.  We saw our waiter once to take our order and then once as the food came and then not again besides to pick up our check, the drinks were never refilled my water was empty before my food even came.  Now onto the food... I get the chicken pen sandwich every time (without peppers) and it&#39;s my favorite sandwich around.  This time it came it was a little burnt but the main problem was one half of the sandwich has a piece of chicken that couldn&#39;t have been more than 2 inches in length and diameter.  I didn&#39;t even eat it so I could bring the bread home and make some chicken at home to put on the sandwich.  When my waitress (I guess they did a shift change) came by she said &#34;looks like you picked out all the good stuff&#34; I said no that&#39;s exactly how it came she chuckled and I just said I&#39;ll take a box to finish making it at home.  I was just disappointed in the lack of service and the price I paid for the lack of chicken in my sandwich.  We were both gonna take a slice of cake home but after that I just wanted to leave cause I was still very hungry.  This place has always been one of my favorite restaurants and hopefully it will continue to be I understand it was chaotic at 4pm on Sunday.  Thank oufor reading my comment and hopefully my experience next time won&#39;t be like this one

I&#39;m not sure what the hype is here. Any restaurant with a ridiculous amount of offerings on the menu can&#39;t be doing them all justice! It&#39;s like a supermarket! Also, be prepared to feel like you&#39;re dining with the tables on either side of you as you are packed in tighter than sardines a can <br>That said, you certainly can&#39;t go wrong with the cheesecake

Great cheesecake! Huge variety, all delicious. Food was good, service was good. A little pricey but the cheesecake at the end of your meal is worth it. Expect to wait for a table though. Waited over 45 min at 4:30 on a Sunday.

We ordered catering trays from The Cheesecake Factory at the Burlington Mall for our New Year&#39;s Eve party. We were told a single tray would feed 6-8 people, would come with plentiful veggies, etc, so we ordered 2 trays and were excited to have some great food for our guests! <br><br>When we picked up the food we were nervous because the bags felt very light but the cashier assured us everything was there. We got home with our order and opened the tins we were SHOCKED by how tiny the portion was. The tray with the Bang Bang Shrimp looked like a portion for a single person. I counted out how many of the tiny shrimp there were in the tray and it was 14, along side a handful&#39;s worth of shredded veggies. We called right away, as we were expecting guests in 10 minutes, and were panicked that we had no where near the amount of food we had paid for ($180 worth). We spoke with a manager, and he told us he would reimburse our credit card payment, and send us a $50 Gift Card as an apology. He told us the refund to the credit card would occur in 2-3 days, and the gift card would arrive by the end of the week. It is now January 11th and we have not received a refund at all, have been given the &#34;run-around&#34; on the phone, and no gift card either. <br><br>The manager revealed to us that they were actually ending their Catering program in the new year, and now we understand why- because it is awful!

Food was good service was kind yet questionable. My friends and I are young girls and feel as though we were kind of taken advantage of. My friend ordered a pizza and 20 minutes later the manager and back and told us the last pizza was burnt and asked her to order something new. She ordered a steak and received her meal as the rest of us were finishing our meals. Once we got the bill we saw that her steak was $30 and she was charged for it when she tried to order a $15 pizza. She did not receive her pizza and ended up paying double for a meal she did not even enjoy.

If you&#39;ve been to one  Cheesecake Factory, you&#39;ve been to them all.  The menu is consistent and the preparation is formulaic.  Its always good and filling, but borderline on value.  The main issue is the seating.  The host desk can best be described as &#34;Town square in during hurricane with an earthquake thrown in for fun&#34;  It&#39;s a mass of confusion and chaos.  I honestly think you could walk in and sit down and NOBODY would notice.

Not bad but also allot of hype about average food. The drinks are a bit small and over priced but the service is good. If you are at the mall and want a interesting menu with good service and want to drop $40 min per person this could be the place for you. To quote my generation yuppie crowd!

Went there for brunch this past Sunday. There&#39;s not much to say about Cheesecake Factory...This location is at the Burlington Mall so it gets crowded really easy. Can&#39;t never get a table on Friday night or weekends most of the time and waiting is usually from 45 minutes to one and a half hours. Place was packed (as usual on Sunday morning)...hostess are not that friendly (they usually looked stressed with 500 people around them looking for tables or complaining about something else) but the food and the service is average ok. Nothing that great but nothing that bad either. Good size portions and they have a giant menu and with hundreds of options. Their cheesecake is unbeatable and that&#39;s one of the reasons we keep coming back. Is a easy $150 bucks for dinner and desert for two.

Ate a fabulous lunch at Cheesecake Factory (Burlington Mall) yesterday consisting of the Monte Christo, the Spicy Chicken Tacos, and Fettuccine Alfredo. Of course, following that came the desserts: one slice of the Original Cheesecake and another of the Oreo Cookie Cheesecake. The service was great. We left very happy and rolled ourselves out to the car...
Great food. The service is awesome. The atmosphere there is great. It is connected to the Burlington mall.

burlington mall is the halfway point for my best friend and i, who lives in maine. so clearly this isn&#39;t our usual location. i had a gift card and coincidentally, it was national cheesecake day or something. this review has nothing to do with the wait time for the cheesecake though as that is completely understandable.<br><br>we had a SUPER friendly server. i don&#39;t want to drop her name in here and expose her for the world to see, but she was super friendly, and relatable, and quirky. she did help me with the menu and she was super nice. <br><br>i ordered the guac made-to-order app for myself as well as the taquito small plate... but i ended up only eating one of my taquitos and wanted to box the rest. <br><br>she didn&#39;t box the taquitos, salsa, or sour cream. just the guac. i was  shoooook. <br><br>i basically wasted my money lol

I&#39;ve never had a bad experience with the Burlington Cheesecake Factory until the other evening when I ordered through Door Dash. I ordered Buffalo Chicken Tenders and shortly after eating some of them, my stomach began to hurt terribly that I had to stop. In the middle of the night, I awoke to the worst abdominal pains ever! These abdominal pains were something else! I had to go to work sick. I am not sure what went wrong with the order.

Came in here for dessert on a Sunday. No wait took a table in bar area.  Had Godiva Cheesecake which was amazing as usual. Server was very attentive and very nice.  Never had a bad place here.  Dinner time usually this place is packed and has a wait.<br><br>Best Cheesecake hands down!

This was a tad disappointing.  I didn&#39;t get my usual burgers and southwest eggrolls, which are almost always 4 stars.  Instead I got a Chicken BLT and my wife got fish tacos.<br><br>Her tacos were the tempura fried ones.  They weren&#39;t that good for a few reasons:<br><br>1. No seasoning/salt added<br>2. Bones still in fish<br>3. The accouterments were....just there, not particularly good<br><br>My Chicken BLT was blah!<br><br>1. Absolutely no seasoning or salt added.  It was painful, very bleh.<br><br>The good news is the service was good, we also got a cheesecake, which gets 4 stars, each, but you go there to eat a meal, and the meal was sub-standard

First time at The Cheesecake Factory was not a success. I don&#39;t know a single person who enjoyed their burger. In fact, I downloaded this app just to write this review. Weak effort, Cheesecake Factory

The menu is extensive but they really don&#39;t have much for those with allergies.  Nothing is worse than going to a major chain restaurant and having half the menu be off limits because they are frying French fries and chicken wings in the same oil as the fish and shrimp :-(.  I mean, they definitely make enough money to cook the seafood separately...

Had a bite to eat here for lunch yesterday.  Still as great as always.  I got the Whiskey Paradise Punch to drink, the Chicken Taquitos as my lunch, and a piece of the Very Cherry Chocolate Ghirradelli (sp??) Cheesecake as my dessert.  Everything looked and tasted phenomenal! The Whiskey Paradise Punch was refreshing, well-balanced, and not too too strong.  I was really impressed with it.  It also looks beautiful as you will see in the pic.  The Chicken Taquitos were delicious.  They were nice and crispy on the outside and drizzled with an avocado cream sauce and pico di gallo. Perfect! The Very Cherry Chocolate Ghirradelli(sp?)  Cheesecake was very decadent as expected.  Cherry Cheesecake on top of chocolate cake with more chocolate on top! Wow! Oh yeah, it also had whipped cream on the side.  Decadent but delicious. I would definitely order it again.  Ambiance was nice to boot, as always.  This place never disappoints me.  Great job again Cheeseake!

Staffs are nice and professional. Foods is great and consistent. That doesn&#39;t mean all of the item on the menu. I didn&#39;t like their orange chicken but If my waiter was not angry when I ask for something else instead. Cheesecake are delicious. I don&#39;t regret spending the 1000+ calories on it. Waiting time can be 15 or the longest 40 min during dinner time when they had a special discount (it was packed.) I came back here multiple time already and plan on returning.

Cheesecake Factory is my go-to default restaurant. (Don&#39;t judge...it&#39;s affordable and large portions!) Got the Salmon Genovese this time and it was pretty good. The couscous could have been a bit more tender and cooked through. But everything tastes great. Fish was well cooked.
Too noisy!! But the food was good. So 3star. The waitress was so busy and just had time to add water.

Will often take the drive to this CCF because the ones downtown are too crowded, and its decent for its location... There is Always a long line here, I work close also &amp; even at 1130 when they open its packed... <br><br>The mall has somthing to do with it... The food is as you would get at any Cheesecake... The menu is big like a book &amp; the selection is crazy, so be prepared to have a total bout of undecideness... Order Everything... <br><br>The corn tamale cakes are TO DIE FOR!
Good food and of course delicious cheesecake. My friend was visiting from the UK and she had always wanted to go, so this was great.

Ordered take out for the kiddos I babysit and they were SO excited. One of them ordered the kids chicken sliders with lemonade and a side of fries. The other ordered a appetizer caeser with extra dressing. They&#39;re a little older and are totally okay with staying home alone for short amounts of time (they&#39;re 12 and the other is almost 14) so I let them watch their movie and popped out to grab the food. I did curbside pick up and I called the number and they said it would be right out. I waited 25 minutes and called again and they said they&#39;d go get it it was still being prepared. I waited about fifteen more minutes and they brought it out. I forgot to check the order before leaving but I wanted to get back to the kids. So I get back to the house and the lemonade is missing and the fries- of course the two things he really wanted. The caeser salad she poured into a bowl and there was about 3 croutons. So I&#39;m already annoyed I paid 14 dollars for a bowl of slightly wilted romaine lettuce. They refilled their bowl after eating less than half the salad and I hear &#34;WOW A GIANT CROUTON&#34; I look over and literally had to knock it out of their hand. It was a soaking wet half eaten bun. There were literal teeth marks. It was SOAKING WET. Almost like it was stuck in a bowl that was washed and it congealed on. I poked through the salad and found another chunk of bread. I would have assumed it was the other kid being a little sibling and putting the crust in the salad but one of them ate outside and it was, from what I can tell, a completely different type of bread. Everyone knows everything at cheesecake is frozen premade or comes out of a bag but this is next level. I called and the manager seemed pretty nice about it and genuinely shocked (that&#39;s why two stars and not one). The kids felt like such little adults and were soo excited to have Cheesecake Factory I felt so bad! Ugh ugh ugh gross

Let me start by saying the Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite restaurants. Having dined at the CCF over 100 times in my life experiencing various locations... the Burlington mall is the best in this state. You can expect wait times up towards 2 hours on the busiest of weekend times. Don&#39;t come around 6-7. Recommend the buffalo blasts, Caesar salad and mushroom burger. Orange chicken &amp; steak Diane are other worthy choices.

So my friends and family came out to the cheesecake in Burlington Ma last night for a birthday dinner celebration. Our estimated wait time was and hour, we waited over an hour and a half to be accommodated so while we waited we decided to head over to the bar and grab drinks. The bartender proceeds to ignore us (like didn&#39;t acknowledge us at all) for the the next 10 minutes. Like flat out ignore. Being busy is understandable, things taking long are understandable, what isn&#39;t though is bad attitude. As a group of people who have all worked in the service industry we were all very surprised at the service we received from a corporate restaurant. So after the bartender finally decided to acknowledge us it takes another while for us to get our drink. My mom came over to the bar and after waiting 10 minutes to even get a hello ended up leaving. As a bartender at a &#34;family&#34; style corporate restaurant my boss would have my ass if I did that to any of my bar guests. I know servers and bartenders tend to not like serving people of color because even though it&#39;s a horrible stereotype (they 90 % don&#39;t tip) but its sad that we can&#39;t enjoy a night out with out being judged by waitstaff. We all get sat and our server is just plain unpleasant. Just making cringey &#34;jokes&#34; and just making everyone uncomfortable. We were not a difficult table at all but he consistently made us feel like everything was too much. Since we all work in the service industry we all know what it&#39;s like to have a bad night but to purposely give &#34;I don&#39;t care&#34; service because of the way your table looks is wrong. We ordered a mojito when we first sat down took a sip of it and realized it was just nasty. Wasn&#39;t muddled, just tasted like passion fruit syrup when we finally got our waiters attention about it ( we were eating dinner at this point and didn&#39;t want a new one) he goes &#34;why did you order it if you don&#39;t like it&#34; (would&#39;ve liked it if it was made properly, had one earlier and it tasted completely different) tables send back things all the time and your reply should never be that!!!! Told the birthday girl she looked &#34;difficult&#34;  when we asked for water he gave us our own hot water he had moved to the end of the table when we said we didn&#39;t want to take something home he basically said well we aren&#39;t taking that off for you when no one even asked him too. Forgot 2 of our appetizers (of-course he did because he wrote nothing down for a 14 top order) And when he realized we all worked in the service industry you just saw the attitude change but by then it was too late. He sucked and you shouldn&#39;t make people feel bad when going out to eat especially when: 1 it&#39;s your job 2 we tip. Even if we were the worst table ever it&#39;s your job to serve people with a smile like we do at our jobs every day.
Had Rebecca as a server and she was so pleasant, she really made our visit. Salad and pasta was also superb and the bread was still hot. Thanks!
Had to wait a little while but Erica at the takeout area was beyond helpful and nice. Wonderful customer service today :)

One of my favorite places around!!! I love coming here with the family on special occasions. The food is delicious the sweets are amazing. Could definitely recommend to check out with the family or alone!

This was my first time at Cheesecake Factory, and it for sure lived up to the hype! The portions are huge so if you want an appetizer, get one to share. Soft drink refills are complementary which is a nice plus! Their menu is very big and varied, so you don&#39;t need to worry about them not having anything you like. The cheesecake is amazing with so many flavors to choose from. Super filling but delicious!

Always okay and never great. <br><br>I really liked the clam chowder although it wouldn&#39;t pass as New England clam chowder. It was lighter and fresher than the typical one and probably deserves a different name. <br><br>The lunch cesar salad also was a little strange. It was just a hugh pile of lettuce with cesar sauce. Little flavor, but a rabbit might have happy with it. <br><br>In summary, without the gift card that needed to be used, I wouldn&#39;t get out of my way to go to Cheesecake Factory.

Party of 9 waiting for over an hour. Called ahead they said the wait would only be 30 minutes. At least 15 tables were seated before us. Food is frozen and everything about this place is over rated. The wait should not be an hour and a half for a chain. However, our waitress Kayleigh was amazing. The only good part about here

First off all of our silverware was filthy...leftover food on it. I was so grossed out couldn&#39;t even drink the water...things floating in it. They need to clean the dishes better. Second our waitress Penny was so rude I almost cussed her out.  I regret the fact that I didn&#39;t get the manager and switch waitresses. She brought us boxes and the bill when we just got our food. And her attitude was just nasty. I was appalled at her behavior. Third I ordered a Factory salad and I could literally count the corn and bacon in it. It was just a Caesar salad with legit 5 little pieces of chicken in it. Was so disappointed.

not the best place to get a good meal.  or drinks.  i asked our waitress what the diff btwn 2 types of proseccos are.  her answer?  &#34;just the price&#34;. LMAO.  are you serious?  i laughed so hard.  <br><br>foodwise, packed with calories and salt.  def a feel good meal..  <br><br>cheesecake?  used to be larger, now it&#39;s 1/2 the size and 2x the price.  you do the math.

About a 20 minute wait by the time we got there, but it was worth it. Large menu with lots of items to choose from. <br><br>Got a drink, it was great. Nice and strong and a great size as well.<br><br>All the food my friends got was great. Large portions and priced well too. $91 for 4 people wasn&#39;t bad at all.<br><br>Aside from the waiting, I was impressed and will be back, hopefully during a slower time where the table wait line is shorter.
Great food, absolutely fantastic desserts in a loud and crowded environment. Expect to wait 20 to 40 minutes along with a hefty tab.

I&#39;m writing this cause we are still waiting for a table . They said 30mins wait , it&#39;s been 55mins .  The manager came and then we were finally being seated ,and then we wait forever for the food too .We are starving with kids ,So bad .

Just went here this past weekend. Someone stole my credit card info. This was my first visit to MA in months and my only transaction there, and now someone in Cambridge area is using my card. It&#39;s too coincidental. The food sucked too but has been good before.
Nice pork chop and tiramisu cake! Only thing is that it&#39;s a little bit expensive... But that&#39;s what it is... All in all I like this place!
Yuck not a fan of their food except the desserts... Next time I&#39;ll just order dessert

Friendly and prompt service, delicious food, and of course amazing cheesecake!! This restaurant can get very busy at peak hours on the weekends and have waits upwards of an hour, but since it&#39;s in the mall I usually go shopping to pass the time. Still so worth it!!

Okay, I know this is a chain, which I never love, but we got a gift card, so we thought we&#39;d give it another try. <br>First, there was an hour and half wait at 8:00 pm. That&#39;s nuts. Not to worry, though, my husband snagged a high top in the bar where we could order food. <br>We first ordered drinks, which were fair, and apps. Mozzarella sticks were good (can you go wrong w that?), but we had an issue with the artichoke dip. We ordered the artichoke dip and clarified that we did NOT want the spinach dip. What did we get?  The spinach dip. So, we sent it back given that warm spinach activates the hub&#39;s gag reflex. The waitress came back and said the artichoke dip was seasonal and wasn&#39;t being offered. Okay, but it was still on the menu, so.....<br>No artichoke dip for us. Fine. On to the meal. I got samosas off the skinny menu. I liked them. Hubby got the jambalaya pasta (it was huge, but at $22- at the CCF- it should be). Kids both got Mac n cheese. This was very good- creamy with large pasta.<br>We finished the meal with cheesecake. Can&#39;t go wrong with Cheesecake Factory Cheesecake. It was delicious. <br>Ultimately, it wasn&#39;t necessarily the food we didn&#39;t love, it was the service. <br>Slow, lacking knowledge, not worth the $130 we paid for dinner. <br>Bottom line, we would rather go to Boston Beerworks and spend $130 than spend it here.

This place is great to eat at but if you are a driver from doordash and pick up their orders they ignore you and take forever to bring you the food.  On top of that I&#39;ve seen other employees talking with cashiers and cashiers ignoring people on line waiting for their food when even when it is not busy.

Great dishes with great atmosphere!<br>Although this restaurant is a chain, the food is nicely prepared with attention to detail.<br>You can have anything at the Cheese Cake Factory. Their menu is ridiculously extensive.<br>For Brunch or for lunch, this place is great!
there&#39;s food is good,but the service is so pool....form the pick-up side，still like your food

Very good experience and the food is absolutely amazing. The only thing I would recommend is having a little bit more courtesy when telling guests their table is ready, especially those who patiently waited over an hour without asking about their wait time once.

I rarely go to the Cheesecake Factory but every time I&#39;m impressed! The menu is huge and the food is always flavorful, but this time what I was most impressed with was the service. Isaiah was our server and he was on top of it. He was very busy with a lot of tables, but always had our waters refilled when they were halfway, asked us if we had any menu questions, was very polite, and checked the kitchen to see if our food would be ready soon. One of the people sitting next to us was being difficult about a missing burger topping, and he was apologetic, respectful, and quickly got the mistake fixed. Before I left I thanked him, and he told me he was new! Other than the fantastic service, the chicken parm &#34;pizza style&#34; was so good, a huuuge circular piece of chicken that filled the whole plate with pasta on top. The egg roll sampler was a fun app, I especially liked the salmon ones. I was stuffed so I got the snickers cheesecake to go, I plan on enjoying it as a midnight snack!

I have been to this restaurant many times in the past but last night was probably the best time I&#39;ve gone. Went in around 7:30 pm and was seated right away. Our waiter Simos was extremely efficient and friendly! My boyfriend and I both had the Chicken Piccata which was delicious, but the chicken to pasta ratio was not what I had in the past. There was little pasta and three big pieces of chicken, it was still great though! Also, the Whiskey Smash drink was good, the second one was a bit sweeter that the first. Overall it was a great experience.

We went to the Cheesecake Factory on a Saturday night for a Mother&#39;s Day dinner. We had a perfect dinner. The wait was a bit long but that was expected and it was worth the wait. Service was great. We put dirty dishes at the end of the table and when our waitress wasn&#39;t available, other waiters took the plates and cleaned up for us so that our table was always clear. The food came out fast and hot. The food was excellent we ordered fried Mac and cheese, chicken dumplings, chicken quesadilla, and Louisiana chicken pasta dish. Everything was delicious I would recommend those items on the menu.

I have never been a huge fan of the cheesecake factory. The menu is huge, with endless options, and portion sizes to match! But I generally I found the food to be mediocre. Just recently realized they do breakfast all day, and I had a wonderful omelette! The drinks, although delicious, are very pricey considering the venue. Most recently I visited because I received a gift card, and was pleasantly surprised to have Fahid as our waiter. He was fantastic! Extremely attentive, polite, helpful, and a delight to talk to. It may be worth visiting just in case you&#39;re lucky enough to sit in Fahid&#39;s section!

Chicken Riesling has crunchy pasta, three sets of dirty silverware, drinks delivered after a reminder half way through the dinner. Never saw waitress after drinks were delivered. Spoke to manager. Offered free cheesecake meh

If you&#39;re eating at a Cheesecake Factory, you probably already know what to expect - generally good quality food at somewhat above-average prices. That&#39;s what you get here, so I&#39;ll just fast forward to the peripherals.<br><br>This restaurant is big. We were a party of 6 showing up at 12:30 for lunch on a Friday. We were told it would be a 10 minute wait for a table, and it was much less than that, so seating and turnover is good here. Service was generally prompt. It took us slightly longer to receive our meals than we thought it should, but just as we were commenting on that, our meals arrived, though 1 of the 6 orders took another 2 minutes to be served.   Our meals were a variety of burgers, chili, and specialty salads all between $12 and $17. <br><br>There was also a mishap clearing a nearby table, which involved broken glass and water on the floor. That was attended to immediately, as were the people sitting at adjacent tables. <br><br>The rest rooms, while adequate, do not seem large enough for a restaurant of this size, nor do I feel they are kid-friendly enough.

Tables and silverware are always dirty. I stopped in because I needed a few things from the mall. Food is decent, but for whatever reason they just don&#39;t wash the tables thoroughly enough. This is not a place I would good to on a regular basis. It&#39;s nice enough if you happen to already be at the mall.

Came here for our 2 year anniversary i should be giving it 2 stars but whatever. Called in to be seated  for a special occasion and was seated at a booth and table seat combo was very uncomfortable and crowded with people next to you shoulder to shoulder. We went back to be re seated no problems we got re seated. Our waitress saw we weren&#39;t wearing a classy out fit or something and thought we weren&#39;t going to tip well and gave us horrible service/attention compared to the seat next to us who she was waiting a very well dressed couple in suit and tie.

Went there for dinner today we ordered the fresh guacamole , fried mac &amp; cheese bites , Santa fee salad &amp; 4 cheese pasta. The fresh guac was out of this world amazing , fresh and delicious the fried Mac and cheese bites was spot on &amp; Santa fee salad was really good on the other hand the 4 cheese pasta wasn&#39;t what we expected but our waitress was so amazing that she kindly took it back and took it off the bill, I wish I got her name because her service &amp; attitude was better than I have received in 5 star establishments specifically this cheese cake factory topped all cheese cake factory&#39;s I have been too !!! We will definitely be back !!!!!!

A great restaurant for any taste pallet. Went here on MLK Day and it was packed. The wait wasn&#39;t too bad. Server and other staff seem well trained. The menu is very large but I ended up getting pizza and my husband had a burger. Both were delicious and cooked exactly as expected. The Reece&#39;s peanut butter and red velvet cheesecakes were huge, tastey, and well worth the price. If I&#39;m in the area again I will definitely go back. It&#39;s well worth it.

Food was great at this location, the Key Lime Cheesecake is very tart but still great, and the Buffalo Blasts are AMAZING! I never get tired of them. The Spicy Chicken Chipotle penne pasta dish is really good.
The plain cheesecake with strawberries is the best I&#39;ve ever had. I&#39;ve driven pretty far just to pick it up!

I was having dinner with my family recently and was very happy with the service. The waiter was very warm<br>And accommodating and the food was delicious.  The restaurant was also very very clean, which is extremely important.<br><br>M. Lannan

This restaurant gets a 5 for Decor but unfortunately I didn&#39;t go there to just look around. Please NOTE: This is NOT a &#34;Vegetarian Friendly&#34; restaurant! Most meals are meat oriented and all salads have meat and no discounts for taking the meat out. It is very clear that there #1 objective is PROFIT and not how to serve the customer better.

1st time at the Cheesecake Factory and i was not impressed. The restaurant is very loud, between the loud music playing over the speakers, and the  high ceilings which are terrible for acoustics. I&#39;m also not a fan of the tables being side by side so you can reach out and taste your unknown neighbors food, seperate tables or all booths please. Now the food. We started with potstickers and Mac and cheese balls. Cheese balls were very good. I had the steak tacos, the shells for the tacos, terrible, but the steak was tasty. I also tried the monster burrito, not to bad. The cheesecake we had for dessert was ok. Would not attend this establishment again, just was not impressed for the $$ we spent. Oh one thing I do want to mention, our server, Thallia, was fantastic, very attentive, great personality and on top of everything. A plus to her.

What&#39;s not to like about this place? Everything in the menu is good, service is usually great, beer always tastes good on tap, place is always hopping so you tell me if it&#39;s good. My fiancé is a veggy and she always finds things to eat, but she does eat fish. If you are a vegan and have complaints about the menu haha this is not your place sorry. Honestly if your vegan most places aren&#39;t your place that just comes with the territory no pun intended. Prices are right and the quality of food is always good. Anybody who would bash this place saying quality of food is not good maybe just expect too much out of any place. Bottom line customers show up in droves to eat here end that speaks volumes for the food and staff. <br><br>Keep up the good work Cheesecake Factory management and staff.

My wife and I went at 6:30 on a Thursday night for dinner...about a 20 minute wait..not bad. Restaurant dark and loud. Seating does not lend itself to privacy or conversation. It&#39;s a bit of a cattle farm. Service was slow..ordered soup for appetizer ..had to remind waiter . It came just a few minutes before our dinner. Very hot...ended up taking it home. Dinners came and mine really wasn&#39;t hot. Some of vegetables had that out of a can taste and appearance. Couple next to us also complained about the speed of service with their waiter. Rating more like a 2.5.

I&#39;ve never been to the Cheesecake Factory before and I&#39;d heard all the hype, so I was quite excited. We&#39;d made a reservation for 11:30 on a Saturday and we were seated immediately. We&#39;ve attempted to go to the Cheesecake Factory on other occasions, but the lines always stretched to the entrance of the mall. <br><br>We were served warm bread and butter as we waited. All four of us got iced tea and lemonade because of the free refills. My boyfriend got 5 refills on his raspberry lemonade. The waiter was very attentive. We ordered the Southern Fried Chicken Sliders as an appetizer and they were so delicious and amazing! I liked it more than my actual meal. I ordered the California Cheese Steak and my boyfriend got the Bacon Bacon Cheeseburger. He raved about the thick cut, slow roasted bacon on his burger. I tried some and it really just melts in your mouth. None of us had room for dessert afterwards, which was sad &#39;cause we were at the Cheesecake Factory! When they boxed up our food, we each got a complimentary cup of iced tea or lemonade (depending on what we ordered) to go! <br><br>Overall, the atmosphere was nice and the service was fantastic! Now I understand the hype! Can&#39;t wait to go back and try some of their other meals and hopefully cheesecake.

Easily without a doubt the worst meal I have ever had at a &#34;Restaurant&#34;. Both of our meals had portions that were either over cooked or undercooked. Neither one of us finished our meals. We should have listened to our instincts and went into Boston. It&#39;s Cheesecake Factory so I wasn&#39;t expecting much but even with my expectations being low they failed. $120 later and I&#39;m still regretting it the next day. For $120 I could have had an extremely pleasing meal some where else. Keep up the terrible work Cheesecake Factory.

The Cheesecake Factory is always great. Our waitress was awesome. My bf&#39;s sandwich was great, my orange chicken was burnt BUT when I mentioned it to the waitress, she brought a new plate in less than 5 minutes. Also, there&#39;s nothing really to say about the cheesecake other than it&#39;s fantastic.
Place is garbage. Everyone that works there has a stick jammed far beyond their bottom holes.

The food is great here (pretty much the same at all Cheesecake&#39;s), but my god - the service. I came here on a Tuesday night for a celebratory dinner for a friend&#39;s anniversary. We were told the wait time was an hour - after an hour, that wait time was extended at least another 35 minutes. <br><br>Our waiter - I wish I caught his name, but very rude. As we were ordering, he kept on yelling that he could not hear a thing. How can we hear all of our orders, but you can&#39;t? Instead of leaning in closer, he made us practically yell out our orders to him. He did this every single time, when ordering both drinks &amp; food. When my brother ordered his meal of Baja Tacos and a side of fries, the waiter said verbatim: &#34;Are you sure you want the fries as well? The Baja tacos are the biggest item on the menu.&#34; When my sister asked for basil in her Farfalle w/ chicken and roasted garlic pasta, he said, &#34;Adding basil to the pasta won&#39;t make it taste good - some dishes aren&#39;t meant for it.&#34; and insisted she should order something else. If someone wants basil, and you can do it, I wouldn&#39;t recommend arguing against it. An older lady at the table only ordered sweet potato fries - she received it at the very end after we asked for the check. The fries were taken off the bill, but still unacceptable. <br><br>If the service was better, this would have been an enjoyable experience.
It was an yet another excellent part of this wonderful chain. Their dishes never disappoint, and the location is convenient, being part of the large Burlington Mall.

Can you please get my orders right. Same kid 2 orders in a row can&#39;t complete correctly a 3 order meal and a order of dessert. My eggplant was hard and cold the past that came with it was a lump stuck together, the other kid ordered a turkey club and got a chicken sandwich with terrible spices on it, I can say my friends chicken alfredo was good he didn&#39;t complain. The staff can do a way better job at making sure mistakes are minimized. I should have known when a lady was complaining about her salmon being cold and odd tasting. And before all this I was always satisfied with the food.

I haven&#39;t been here in years but decided to meet my brother and his wife there. 30 min wait but we were sat in 15 not bad at all. The menu is always large and full variety. I got the miso salmon served with rice. The fish was good but the rice was not fresh at all, some of it was hard and I hate that. Apps was the avocado rolls fried not bad at all. The Buffalo chicken blast way to greasy and just couldn&#39;t eat it. Overall service was good. I don&#39;t think I will be back anytime soon.

Herb-Rubbed Salmon - good<br>Nachos- Good<br>Santa Fe Chicken Salad- Good although they sometimes gip you on the chicken and one time they put lettuce chunks into it.<br>Overall - I&#39;ll still keep going back for more.
Never had a bad meal. The menu accommodates everybodies tastebuds. The cheesecake is to die for, but that&#39;s a given!

They had great steak with mashed potatoes. We all ate dinner quickly so we could try out the cheese cakes, THEY WERE DELICIOUS! I loved the texture and the flavor, the chocolate was rich and smooth. Made cheesecakes one of my favorite cake!

The food was great but the server was terrible. He got an attitude when I asked to split and my other guest asked for a cheesecake. He gave me the incorrect change and just threw it on the table. I chose not to tip for horrible service. First time in Boston and very disappointed.

Our waiter Jensen was an absolute treat! He was such a pleasure. We had 5 people in our party and he was very attentive and made sure to use our names. He was so friendly and we could tell he really cared about giving us the best possible service. He really did make our experience so much more fun and pleasurable. Thank you Jensen!!!!!!!

Occasionally I go here but lately I have stopped by twice after work to get something to go when I was exhausted. I order the same thing each time with lots of details and it&#39;s always spot on. Thai chicken pasta, no chicken, extra sauce on the side, bread, utensils, no butter.  With the exception of melted butter at the bottom once it&#39;s always great and the pickup staff is awesome.<br><br>I love the convenience of this and the quality. Huge fan just wish the sit down lines weren&#39;t always so long. Minus one point for that.

The front desk black woman who takes your name to wait for seating is extremely rude. Her attitude is your first impression. Even if she can handle the amount of people in front of her; she does is rudely. Not someone I would have representing my company.

Cheesegate is one of my fav... Great food and great quality. You are almost guaranteed to get something you like and i love so many things there that it is always hard to decide on which. Stuffed mushrooms and the egg rolls are the best. Though their drinks are not good i dont drink so doesnt cut into my reviews.<br><br>the quality of service is good too and has always delivered consistency in the quality and taste of food. No complains

I&#39;m usually very pleased with the Cheesecake Factory meals, however yesterday was my second not so great meal at this location, a couple of years ago I had fish and chips lthat was horrible, wet fried fish?. Yesterday I had the Cobb salad, a tasteless plate of wilted soggy lettuce, no bacon or tomato that I could detect, very little egg, tastless blue cheese.<br> Maybe it&#39;s just this location, as I said I usually have goood with them, just not in Burlington.

We had my grandfathers 85th birthday dinner here yesterday. The food was delicious as usual (chicken Madeira, hibachi steak, salted caramel cheesecake) but what really made our experience so wonderful was our awesome server Jessica!! She was so attentive and so genuinely kind to my family, she really made us feel taken care of! It was crazy busy but she never made us feel rushed, it meant so much to me, she made my grandfather feel really special.  Thanks Jessica C!!!
Food sucked on my last visit. Manager came to apologize but damage was done <br>What can I say!

I&#39;d brought guests on their last day of stay for lunch. The server made a mistake with the POS and messed up the order of one of the guest, and we had to wait for the food to be made again.<br><br>The server, who most likely got a scolding from the manager, took it out on us and were very cold and rude to us. Shame indeed. She turned the entire lunch experience to a mess, and I felt very sorry for the guests. The manager and the server did nothing to improve the lunch, only making it worse thanks to the cold server.<br><br>If I&#39;d been the manager at the place, the server would be fired without question.

Some of the best food and service here. I have been coming to this Cheesecake Factory for some time and the food and service is always spectacular. We came on a Last Sunday evening at 11 pm It wasn&#39;t as bad till the night progressed. Anyways, the waiter introduced us as we sat down. I swear, the bread and water arrived in under a minute as we sat down looking at the menu. <br><br>Ordered the chargrilled steak. The food was promptly delivered. I have to applaud our waiter for always checking up on us. I had a glass of Coke and had it refilled many times without me asking. The waiter took initiative which I really liked. <br><br>And of course, after our main course was finished, we had some slices of their infamous cheesecakes. Overall, I would keep coming here!

Service was terrible changed server and the original server was in other tables .. when the food finally arrived it was cold .. first cheesecake factory that we receive bad service .. and we travel quite frequently and its a chain that we usually trust but not this time
I typically have good experiences at the Cheesecake Factory. Other than the wait time, the actual service was fairly quick and courteous. I always enjoy my meals here.

Had a really good meal, with good service. Value to meal ratio was off, and would probably give a 3.5 star if I could. <br>Service- I think this REALLY depends on when you dine here and people&#39;s perception after waiting for 2hrs. There was a lot of negative reviews on service but we had a good experience. Sunday at 4pm, was seated in 15 minutes just as told. Waitress was good (not great).<br>Food was brought out within 15 minutes of ordering.<br><br>Food- Really good- this is not boston north end dining... but with that in mind the food was great. Five in our party and everyone enjoyed their food. Servings we generous.<br>Parmesan Herb Crusted Chicken - delicious, cooked perfectly. Mashed potatoes and green beans were good. The sauce was slightly oily but very tasty. <br>Carne steak medallions - very good, cooked as asked with a great flavor<br>Mac and Cheese app- 14 and 16 Y/O got this as meal, son was able to finish but not daughter. Both loved it.<br>Pork Chops- very good<br>Drinks - small wine list, got one drink and it was below average<br>Value to Food - We averaged $40 a head with three teenagers and two adults. One wine glass and one drink... two of the kids got only an app and a cheesecake. <br>The prices are so high that if I had to wait more than half hour I could see the stars start to come down....<br>Overall, good for lunch or other down times. Good atmosphere and easy to talk (not to loud).

Another stop on the path to the ultimate Cuban (see Dave&#39;s Fresh Pasta.) It&#39;s a chain so one comes to expect consistency and quality, which the CF delivered.<br><br>The advertisements in the menu are, um, groundbreaking. Yeah. I still can&#39;t believe the dentist in there has the website cheesecakedentist dot com. A little misleading and self-propagating, wouldn&#39;t you say?<br><br>Service is hit or miss, as to be expected with any chain. The sandwich and fries were cooked perfectly, ample quantities of both and the price showed. When I realized there was no mustard on the Cuban, I asked the server for a side and she brought a small glass bottle of French&#39;s. I used my knife to spread the stuff and thought &#34;This is odd. Who else stuck their utensils in here?&#34; Ah well, I&#39;m not the germaphobe but it left an impression.<br><br>The place is enormous. A friend and I went during the heart of lunch hours and were met by a madhouse of shoppers, bizfolk and summer break teens. Remarkably, we were still sat in under 10 minutes proving once and for all, size matters.

I&#39;m addicted to Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>Although overwhelming at times, their extensive menu offers SO many delicious choices. I can always find something no matter what I&#39;m craving. <br><br>Reason it gets 4 stars instead of 5 is: <br><br>1. The prices are a bit steep but the portions are huge, so its like you are paying for 2 meals since I always have left overs. <br><br>2. There is always a rediculous wait (1 hr +) and they dont take reservations. <br><br>3. Every location I have been to has NO parking. Even the ones at the malls are difficult to park at. <br><br>I have tried too many items to list but some of my favorite are BUFFALO BLASTS and THAI LETTUCE WRAPS. <br><br>LOVE LOVE LOVE the THAI LETTUCE WRAPS. :) <br><br>The drinks are also EXCELLENT. I have tried several of their alcoholic drinks and have enjoyed everyone of them. My favorite is the Mojito. Cheesecake Factory makes the best Mojito I have ever had. <br><br>Although I dont get it, the decor is great. Vaulted ceilings, roman columns. Plenty of seating including outdoors. <br><br>4.5 stars for Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>DAMN GOOD.

Ugh. I came all the way from Cali to Boston to eat at Cheesecake Factory? You gotta be joking me. But apparently there&#39;s only like 5 restaurants near Billerica, so this was a safe choice. I guess.<br><br>I won&#39;t bore you with the details of TCF, but the one thing I did notice about this place different from the others ones I&#39;ve been to is that they don&#39;t dim the lights very much. I remember the other TCFs I&#39;ve been to in the past were dark like dungeons. Or maybe that&#39;s just me.<br><br>I have a feeling I&#39;ll end up here again anyways.

Weekend after Christmas and this place is packed. Typical Cheesecake Factory experience- but hey I love it! <br><br>First of all, you can&#39;t beat that crazy brown bread they bring out. So so so so good! Legitimately makes the whole trip worthwhile. <br><br>Entreewise- I had the lunch portion of the Davinci Pasta. Good but too salty for me. Also huge portions so I&#39;ll be eating it for a few days. Boyfriend got Fish and Chips, which was delightfully crispy and not too oily. Also the portion of cole slaw was appallingly large. Does anyone eat that much cole slaw? <br><br>Anyways after those portions there was not enough room for cheesecake but whatever. Like I said, that stupid bread makes it all worthwhile.

When I got to Boston it was pretty late in the evening and my aunt and uncle took me here to grab some late dinner. Honestly, I&#39;m okay with Cheesecake Factory. I mean I don&#39;t hate it, but I feel it&#39;s a little over-hyped, perhaps. But there are some pretty good dishes. The server was always attentive and really friendly.<br><br>For appetizer we had the Crab and Artichoke dip with sourdough bread, which was presented in a small little pan - it&#39;s so cute! <a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/MpfauJengAZHTzoIkwP_yw?select=2dldkYsknyx9d1lw9u9h6w">yelp.com/biz_photos/Mpfa…</a> And the dip was pretty good. I had their special of the night, which was catfish with a crusted topping, with mashed potatoes and some mixed veggies. It was okay, the crusted topping buried the catfish filet and it just looks like a pile of crusted topping only. <a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/MpfauJengAZHTzoIkwP_yw?select=tT3_fWAY0qNnfrv655-Lqw">yelp.com/biz_photos/Mpfa…</a><br>For dessert, my aunt and I shared a piece of their apple crumble cheesecake with caramel. <a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/MpfauJengAZHTzoIkwP_yw?select=kxXJLwb4H1LEkqn8AyUn8Q">yelp.com/biz_photos/Mpfa…</a> It was pretty good. Next time when I return to another location, I want to try this mango cheesecake...woohoo for mangoes!

So we went for dinner. There were 9 of us. It took over a hour to get our food.  Then when tow people got their pasta dish thepasta was over cooked and gummy. I got orange chicken. The chicken was so over cooked it was like eating plastic.  One person didn&#39;t even get her meal. They forgot to cook it. Most sent their food back and it took another hour for the food to come out. The person waiting for their food STILL didn&#39;t get hers.  I had to argue with the manager to take my orange chicken off the bill since I sent it back and didn&#39;t get a new dish.  We sat there for over 3 hours.  When we all got up our legs were like rubber for sitting so long. I contacted the cheesecake factory via email twice and twice they ignored it.  I will never come back to this place again. They apparently don&#39;t care about their customers.

Every time we&#39;ve visited it has been fantastic. My boyfriend and I frequent this location for our nights out. We love Lauren! She&#39;s the best server they have. Super friendly, awesome recommendations and always makes sure you&#39;re taken care of and satisfied with everything. Ask for her when you go! Went last night with a friend and we started with the buffalo blasts. If you like buffalo chicken you need these. The Georgia peach and frozen strawberry margarita are so yummy. Reasonably priced at just under $12 each. The blood orange margarita was delicious as well. Strong and beautifully decorated. For entrees I got my favorite pasta da vinci and she got a bbq burger. Their soups are so good too! They change everyday and I always get the clam chowder and baked potato soup when available. We really took our time drinking and eating as we were catching up, and Lauren never made us feel rushed once but knows just when to check in and see how you are :) for dessert we got vanilla bean and the coffee kahula. Obviously the best cheesecake ever! It can get really busy on the weekends but it&#39;s worth the wait!

Why do you ask me to go to your Corporate page to put in my information so you can contact me??? When you have NEVER contacted me??? To me, Corporate is worse than the restaurant. Why ask for information when you have no intention of contacting the person???

My wife and I walked in, and the hostess sat us right away. The entire restaurant wasn&#39;t busy and plenty of servers were around. Our server was quick to arrive and get us our water and give us our menus... Twenty minutes later our server hasn&#39;t even walked by our table to take our order or check up on us. <br><br>So, we grabbed our coats and left. The only person that seemed to notice us leave was the hostess, the only person at the Cheese Cake Factory that deserves any sort of praise. If I was the manager of that place, I would fire most of my staff. <br><br>Just terrible, I will not be going back.

Very loud, but comfortable environment.  The menu is ridiculously extensive.  The food is expensive, but the portions are large.  We had two super tasty apps, the fried zucchini and the tex mex egg rolls.  I have had the avocado egg rolls before and they are tasty too.  My boyfriend had a massive burrito he was quite happy with and I had fish tacos that were overstuffed and impractical to eat, but super tasty.  The cocktails are pricey but good.  The desserts are crave worthy.

I love this place, it&#39;s one of my all time favorite restaurants. It has a wide variety of things on the menu, small plates to big plates. I love to come here for appetizers and a glass of sangria. The corn tamale cakes are awesome, chicken and mushroom lettuce wraps are great, and the Caeser salad here is my family&#39;s favorite.<br>The Adam&#39;s Cheesecake is amazing, especially if you love Reese&#39;s and Butterfingers like I do.<br><br>Great place to come if you want food, but you&#39;re not sure what you&#39;re in the mood for. They seriously have everything.

I have been here a few times before and always had a good experience.  But last night was different.  We had gone to celebrate our son&#39;s birthday.  The server was indifferent and truly did not &#39;serve&#39; us.  He came to take our order for drinks, appetizers and main course.  Never checked on us during the meal.  Did not pick up the appetizer plates when the main course was served.  Did not ask us if we wanted dessert or coffee and just came and placed the check on the table and left.  This is not what one expects - it was an expensive meal and we left feeling disheartened.

I haven&#39;t actually eaten dinner at a Cheesecake Factory in several years, but we were given a gift card so we figured it was time to take the plunge. The place as big as other Factories I&#39;ve been to and the wait would have been just as long, but thankfully we had reservations. <br><br>We were seated promptly, but it probably took about 12 minutes before a waiter came over and acknowledged our presence. I lost track of how long it took before we actually got the drinks we ordered and when we were able to put in our food order.
